Overall%20Experience.Review: I appreciated the University's welcoming orientation that was thorough, diverse, emphasized its care for student safety and success, and included a variety of options to customize your experience and imagine the perfect student life for you. Housing was perfectly accommodating and the process when completed timely is simple and effective. College specific advisors were, again, instrumental to my success in completing the appropriate university requirements for graduation, completing the proper prerequisites for my undergraduate program, and in my future application to graduate school. The opportunities for participation in social activities, sports/recreation, professional development, clubs, organizations, and so on are ENDLESS. There is something for everybody. The university promotes DEI. Most, if not all, professors are accommodating, patient, resourceful, and demonstrate genuine interest/ passion in course subject and helping students succeed. UF would be my choice every time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the University of Florida and the expansive list of classes and rewarding opportunities! Though I have only experienced a few months with the university, it has been a truly life-changing experience to say the least. I have been able to experience fun opportunities and apply for mentorship programs as well as talk to amazing groups and clubs that are so passionate about what they achieve. I am a UF online student, but I still get to experience the same opportunities as my peers who may be on campus. UF is inclusive, and all around an amazing campus and university bursting at the seams with opportunity. I am so humbled and overjoyed that I get to know the joys of being a UF Online student, and I can’t wait for all I have yet to experience. Go Gators!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Very good univerty
Offers competitive lectures 
The overall culture and students,teacher relation is very good which helps international students so much.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's been pretty ok so far. It is very difficult academically and it doesn't help that the professors don't seem to really care about you when it comes to very large lecture hall type classes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like that the college is the entierty of the city, there is unlimited spots to study. Since the campus is so big, it offers a diversity that will fit every ones needs. For those who like to study there are special dorms that tend to be more quiet and there are cafes off campus to study at. However they also have sority row which will allow for the more extroverted people to go out and party, they have dorms that tend to be louder and hnagout more. Along with the amout of space that is avaiable to study at for those who dont like to be in scilence.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love going to school here. I am a proud Gator. This school provides a sense of community and pride, while continually challenging me in my education. Preparing me for my career through networking and support from my professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Teachers were nice but stern. no Lee-way. Advisors are nice and there to help you and care. Cheap price compared to all Colleges around me, I would recommend going here if you can get in. Academics are challenging, and time consuming, you'll definitely learn here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Honestly great school. Beautiful campus with student activities daily. I truly enjoy my college and professors who want to see me succeed. I wish we had more food options, but there is only so much a campus can take on.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I wasn't big on going out but I always had plenty of opportunities to go out, both on campus and off. More often than not, I would go out for dinner because the food options around the campus were great. 
The disability resource center was great as well, both to be a student of and work at, so if you need help that is a good option. Most student services are, including the CWC, UF Psychiatry, and the MCDA. Certain departments kinda suck, not because they're unhelpful but because it takes so long to get help.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had a great experience at the university of florida so far. I love the campus and the academics as well as all the opportunities for internships, scholarships, and immersion experience given by my college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The University of Florida (UF) is an outstanding institution with a strong reputation for academic excellence. The courses are challenging yet rewarding. Students are provided with a wide range of opportunities for research, internships, and clubs, which enhances the academic experience.
UF gives me a welcoming and inclusive atmosphere. Whether you're on campus for the first time or returning for another semester, you'll find that the community is supportive and friendly. The students, faculty, and staff make a real effort to help newcomers feel at home, and there’s a strong sense of school pride and unity.
Overall, UF offers a top-tier education in a vibrant and welcoming environment, making it a great choice for students looking to succeed academically while being part of a diverse and supportive community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My overall experience at the University of Florida has been incredibly rewarding, both academically and personally. As a PR master’s student, I’ve had the opportunity to engage in cutting-edge coursework, real-world case studies, and hands-on projects that have strengthened my expertise in public relations. The faculty are experienced professionals who provide valuable insights and mentorship, making the learning experience highly engaging.
One of the standout aspects of my time at UF has been the networking and career development opportunities. The university frequently hosts guest lectures, career fairs, and industry panels that expose students to professionals working in top firms, agencies, and corporations. These opportunities have allowed me to make meaningful connections and gain insights into the expectations of the industry.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida has a great variety of activities, events, clubs, etc. for each student's diverse interests. The academics are extremely rigorous but usually feel like they are contributing to your abilities in a positive manner. The biggest issue I had at the University of Florida was with the advising, or lack thereof. Advisors are extremely difficult to get in contact with and your emails and questions can oftentimes get passed from person to person without being answered. However, there are lots of students and staff who do want to help you and who are willing to sort of fill this role. If you are able to make connections with a few professors in your first year or so you will be ok even if your advisors and administration are less than helpful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF has so many opportunities to be involved with clubs and organizations. Additionally, it offers many opportunities within your college to gain experience, volunteer, and a variety of courses. I have grown as a student journalist with the many programs offered and have loved my time here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think Florida is the perfect school because it has everything! There is always something to do or someone to hang out with, but everyone also really prioritizes their studies. It is definitely a work-hard play-hard school. I honestly could not have picked a better school!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed my time at the University of Florida. UF is a research university so there are lots of great opportunities to get involved in a lab! The people are all friendly, the professors are great and well-connected! I'd definitely recommend UF to anyone considering enrolling.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: To be quite honest, UF wasn't my first choice school. It barely cracked my top three initially. I got into my top 2 choices: Duke (go Blue Devils) and Notre Dame (go Irish), but cost-wise, both options were simply unrealistic. So, I didn't come into freshman year with the rose-tinted glasses that most freshman do at a legacy school like mine. I was quick to point out anything that I didn't like because I guess, in my mind, it reinforced my elevation of the other schools I go into. But to be frank, there wasn't much to point out. The culture surrounding Duke and Notre Dame were the main draws for me. Yes, I wanted to attend an academically rigorous school, but I also wanted to, you know, have fun! I didn't realize until I got up here but UF offers, in my opinion, the best of both worlds. I'm a part of the honors program, so I have to option to "up the ante" so to speak on the academic side of things, but since UF is an SEC school with deep traditions, there's also a lot...else to enjoy!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I honestly love attending UF. There is always something going on and plenty of activities to get involve with. I also like that UF has a good balance between academics and social life. I recommend everyone to attend if they get in!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Love UF.  Great place to be and study.  Lots of opportunities inside outside and the classroom.  
Great athletics
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I am currently pursuing a Master’s in Public Health at the University of Florida, and my experience has been exceptional. The program offers a robust curriculum that combines theory with practical application, preparing students to tackle real-world public health challenges. The professors are knowledgeable, approachable, and genuinely invested in student success.

The University of Florida provides ample resources for academic growth, including research opportunities, networking events, and career services. Additionally, the diverse and supportive community has made my journey here truly rewarding.

I highly recommend the MPH program at UF to anyone passionate about making a difference in public health!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the campus life, the energy, and the school spirit it's very welcoming and so are the people. I want to change the diversity, there is more of a lack of diversity than I wanted to see but overall it's a good school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors within the journalism school have been amazing, very attentive and truly care for there students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: 20-25 minute break between lectures because sometimes we have to take a 15-minute walk to get to the location of the other lecture by which it will already have started
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Transferred into the University of Florida from a local community college. I am enjoying it as my final two years of college. Some Professors are hit or miss and don't prepare you for work in the real world. Lots of opportunities yet it is very competitive, make sure to go out and network.  Overall a prestigious public university. Go Gators
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall my experience at the University of Florida suprised me. I didn't expect to enjoy campus life or anything that University had to offer. Once you find your people and you study something you enjoy campus life and university life becomes enjoyable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is exactly what you picture when you think of your stereotypical college life. Big SEC and greek life school, but everyone can find their own thing easily. So many students from different colleges and backgrounds, so you'll be able to find your niche.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I highly recommend the University of Florida. From a professional standpoint, the academic experience is exceptional as the faculty are incredibly dedicated. As a Business Management major with a Communications minor, I can specifically speak to the outstanding programs in both the business and communications schools.

In terms of campus life, UF offers many exciting opportunities. I've had the chance to attend Miami Heat games, visit Disney and Universal for free, and experience the excitement of Gator football games, which draw fans from all over the country to "The Swamp." The student government organizes various events, like free carnivals and movie nights, making campus life vibrant and engaging.

While the campus lacks diversity in some areas, there are plenty of opportunities to connect with people from different backgrounds through specific student organizations. Overall, my time at UF has been incredibly rewarding, and I truly couldn't have asked for a better four years.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have deeply enjoyed my time as a student at the University of Florida; I transferred in 2023 and I plan to graduate this year. The professors at this university have been central to by educational development. With support from them, I have been quite successful in my extracurricular ventures, including fellowships, internships, and study abroad experiences.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Since I began attending the University of Florida, I have never been happier and felt overall wellness in my life. Although I dearly adore my parents and enjoy coming home for the occasional visit, my home is the University of Florida, and I always feel safe in the presence of my institution. Even though I can list a million things I love about my school, there is a need to improve the food quality in their dining halls.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a new student to the school, however my impression of the University has been a positive one so far. I like the broad variety of available classes that I can choose from.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a second year, I love the University of Florida. Unfortunately, it is a very difficult school thus I wish it was a little bit easier, and the point to letter grade ratio was better and more consistent between professors and classes. Otherwise, I could not see myself anywhere else and would choose UF over and over again.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am in love with the University of Florida. Coming from south Florida, I never thought I would be able to enjoy somewhere like Gainesville. However, I find more reasons to love this school everyday.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the campus, the community and the academic rigor offered at the University of Florida. Safety was somewhat of an issue as there were some recent shootings near the campus and break-ins.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a marvelous and very fruitful experience in my life - academically, networking wise, opening opportunities, and made several great friendship connections in a very diverse environment. Very grateful!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a large school; the people there are very nice and most people will try and befriend you your first year.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: While I have been a resident of Gainesville for over 12 years, I never explored the University of Florida campus. When I moved onto campus and explored it for the first time, I was pleasantly surprised. I love the openness and scenery of campus, there is an abundance of wildlife and I am a big fan of the brick buildings as I feel like they add a historic touch. I have only completed one semester so far as a freshman, but almost all of the professors I have had were incredibly nice people. Although some of the science department professors could use revision in their teaching methodology. Personally, I am not able to thoroughly learn (and I know many others I have spoken to share the same feelings) through the new teaching method of "flipped learning" where the students watch pre-recorded lectures that have been recycled since 2018 on their own time and the in-person lectures are not spent being taught.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
UF is by far one of the best value in terms of tuition. The facilities and labs are really quite impressive, with ample opportunity to work under a professor as an undergrad researcher. Professors join UF from around the world to do research there, so really some top-tier opportunities. FSU and UCF has this too, of course, but not quite the global reach that UF seems to have.

UF is also the town’s whole identity. Gainesville is a tiny town with a modest suburb and definitely a small “downtown”. The whole of Gainesville tends to revolve around the university. You will see Gator memorabilia everywhere, student specials or discounts at restaurants and bars, FREE public bus rides.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am enjoying my time at the University of Florida so far. There are many resources and opportunities for students to achieve success as they begin their career.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: So amazing and very fun the classes were very good and they were also super hard like the professors were cray.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love it here at the University of Florida! The people are so nice and helpful. It is a beautiful, historic campus. There is always something going on, either on campus or close by. There is a group for every type of person here. I love the sports culture and going to The Swamp. Go Gators!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love studying at the University of Florida. The students and faculty are extremely focused, driven, and passionate about academia.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great experience. You get to meet people while obtaining high-quality education. Very easy to get involved and find all sorts of opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great community to be a part of while pursuing a degree. Plenty of space and inspiration to pursue individual interests and find a community to support those interests. Beautifully diverse.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing school to be at as it academically challenges me and prepares me well for my future of going into medicine. I would like better selection of professors and more renovated dorms.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Gainesville has a great community of creatives and a great food scene . I like the flexibility of online courses . It allows me to earn an income while studying and I can pursue experiences in my preferred fields before graduating .
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF is a great place to go if you have no other option. It's a politically charged climate, with leadership chasing arbitrary metrics to make UF "Top 10," without a tangible vision otherwise. Apparently some board member's daughter wanted to go to UMich instead of UF and their bitterness is now University policy. Of course, there's also the drama behind appointing a republican senator with no experience to run the place for a year and a half. Big surprise that ended with a vague scandal. Lets not forget the faculty at UF signed a professor application for an anti-vaxxer who is now the FL surgeon general. What a bastion for academic rigor. It's a campus that has sold its academic soul to conservative donors and State government grants, like a vestigial appendage, or perhaps tumor. We spend lots of (tuition) money recruiting academics from top-tier institution, who usually leave within a couple years after they see dumpster fire. That being said, it's probably the best school in Florida.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far my time at the University of Florida has been heavily impactful on my life. Being an out of state student I thought it would be hard to find community and fit in the academic talent throughout campus. As I've been here I have come to an understanding that it's easy to find your place here. I have never met kinder people in my life and the rigorous courses are helping me to thrive as an individual. While the workload may be heavy and I still may feel homesick, the community I have built, the people I surround myself with, and my commitment to my education has made me feel as though I belong here. The University of Florida is a welcoming space for individuals all over the world. I'm proud to be a student here, proud of my accomplishments that brought me here, and proud of my future self for what I have to come in my next four years.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Political climate in Florida is a mess to say the least, and while the school is a public institution standard practice of voting in a new school President was blatantly ignored. Faculty's veto of said President was forgone by Board of Trustees who are in majority profiteers of large development businesses. Office politics that also exist here reflect this environment as its seeps into each departments funding and future plans. Growth of off campus housing has exploded and deteriorated the unique community that use to surround the neighborhoods of campus. As an Alum with many friend and family members who have also attended UF, its good to see present students and faculty fighting for their voices against the conservative government that is trying to dismantle preeminent academics. While your education will depend upon personal commitment and those around you, understand the even those whose will want to stay out of politics will be confronted by it on multiple fronts I certainly was.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida offers a fantastic blend of strong academics and vibrant campus life, making it a great place for both personal and professional growth. The diverse range of programs and research opportunities allow students to excel in their fields. The campus is beautiful and the school spirit, particularly around athletics, is infectious. However, the large student population can sometimes lead to overcrowded classes and limited access to resources. Improved administrative efficiency and more accessible mental health services would be beneficial. Overall, it's a top-notch institution but with some areas in need of enhancement to better support its students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is a fantastic choice for computer engineering students. The curriculum is rigorous yet rewarding, offering a solid foundation in programming, data structures, and hardware. The faculty is knowledgeable and supportive, always encouraging students to push boundaries. Resources like labs, research opportunities, and collaborative clubs such as the Computer Science Honors Society provide hands-on experience essential for career development. The campus fosters a vibrant, innovative environment that encourages interdisciplinary learning and personal growth. Gainesville itself is a lively town with a strong student community. UF genuinely prepares students for future tech careers, making it a worthwhile investment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a student at the University of Florida, I have generally enjoyed my experience at UF. The classes are really hard, but we are offered lots of helpful resources to aid our academic success. I would like to see more buses to aid in transportation around campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Not very accommodating to first generation students and seem to prioritize profit over student success.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far, I've loved it. All the people I've met are so eager to help you and genuinely want to see you succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I became very involved on campus and really enjoyed those opportunities. Being involved in greek life also made a huge difference in my college experience. I believe that the only reason I would have to complain on would be the high volume of online classes. I did struggle to build a schedule with minimal online classes and this resulted in me taking the majority of my courses online since they were not offered in person.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love attending UF. The night life is exciting, there are always student activities on campus to partake in, and plenty of opportunities for clubs. However, other than going out and drinking, there aren't many things to do in Gainesville off campus. I would also like to say that the dorms here can be terrible depending on where you live. I live in a dorm that hasn't been redon yet, and we've had issues with leaks, mold, and plumbing. The academics are challenging, but there are ample resources to help students when they're struggling in classes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is a great institution. There are numerous opportunities to join clubs and meet new people. The academics are strong but mostly online which really takes away from the holistic learning experience. The party life is very prominent. It is a very big part of the social aspect of schooling.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed going to UF but some of the required classes were useless. I wish there were more resources for international students
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: uf is in a very calm town, so most students can focus on academic pursuits. The reason I ended up choosing this university was because of the low tuition. I am grateful for this because I feel that tuition at such a great university is affordable for most people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've really enjoyed my experience here so far. The courses are more rigorous here compared to other colleges but as long as you pay attentions to lectures, take notes, and give yourself ample time to study you will be fine, it's manageable as long as you take the right steps. Once you fall behind it's hard to catch up. I stayed on campus my first year. I stayed in Thomas Hall during my freshman summer semester, do not recommend it, the rooms themselves were nice and bigger than expected but it is a communal bathroom and our bathroom flooded at one point and was unusable for several weeks, we had to go to other dorms to access their bathrooms. During Fall and Spring I was in Hume Hall, I enjoyed it way better and I never had any problems, though if you have a car parking can be difficult as the parking spots fill up fast. Overall, I've really liked UF and while Gainesville is small there is more to do here than I thought.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I can only speak toward the College of Education. My experience with the COE has been amazing. The professors are extremely kind and helpful. They genuinely want to see you succeed in your career as an educator. The support and research done with in the college itself is incredible. They have a sincere goal to make learning more fun and make education respected like it used to be. I wouldn't want to see anything change.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the college environment and everyone really has similar goals and is dedicated to their education. It’s rigorous but there’s many opportunity a and chances to explore and grow while having fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely loved the University of Florida. It is not too much of a college town, and is surrounded by more rural areas. Go gators
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: A very large University but many opportunities to find your community within the University. Off-campus housing is a struggle but there are good places you can find. The University has many resources to help students with just about every problem they could have both academically and personally. Has an amazing Disability services for  students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Florida is very fun, there's lot to do, a big campus and UF football game days are always an experience. There are so many ways to get connected and involved. A lot of opportunities that are shared and overall, just a good school. I feel like UF is setting me up to succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida has quickly shaped who I am as a person. Its not just the amazing school that I go too, it is my forever home where I have found the bets people to surround myself around.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: At UF, I really love how big the campus is and that there are so many majors to pick from. It’s great because you can try out different things before settling on a path. Plus, the game days are just a blast! Everyone comes together to cheer on our teams, and the energy is awesome. The food options could definitely use some improvement. It’d be great to have more variety and healthier choices available on campus. Sometimes it feels like the same things are served over and over again.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My professors have been very nice but I think that's because my majors have been essentially bubbles of kind people who all know each other. Outside of my major I don't really know anyone and I'm not a part of traditional student life or culture. I know it's difficult though for many students and it's very hard to accommodate for what is needed when it's such a polarizing environment to exist and learn in.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I feel like there is always something to do, which helps when bored and can be overwhelming when stressed. I also find there is so many different ways to find community, with the large number of student organizations on campus. The food options are also not awful for on campus living students with a meal plan, I can have balanced meals majority of the time. I also feel like while everyone is striving for greatness, there is a silent acknowledgement among all students when it is time to slow down and take a break from all the academics. There is a great balance of academics and the "party life" aspect at UF.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love going to this school! Plenty of places to go, clubs to participate in, and sports to watch. The dining hall food isn’t the greatest but there is variety. I overall think this is a good school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The people here are very friendly, however the campus itself is highly lacking when it comes to aesthetics, cleanliness, and sorority/fraternity empathy. The party scene is heavily active, however, and the sports teams there are D1 for a reason.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I genuinely like staying and studying at the university of Florida. All the professors are extremely accomodating and helpful whenever necessary. The students are also really nice. Overall an amazing environment to be in.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The education here is quite good and lives up to the expectations of a top public university in the country. The surrounding area is very quiet and full of nature, which I find to be relaxing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love living on campus and participating in the football game day fun.  The professional resources are incredible, and I am almost overwhelmed by how many great opportunities are available to me, especially in the field of biological research.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My overall experience at the University of Florida has pretty good so far at the moment. Things are going very well when it comes to my classes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF offers a wide variety of degree options, along with clubs and organizations to get involved with! Admin and staff are always so helpful and willing to help whenever.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida (UF) offers a dynamic academic environment with strong research programs, particularly in business, healthcare, and digital media. Known for hands-on learning and global research, UF fosters a vibrant campus community through extracurriculars and athletics. While the school has extensive resources and support services, some students find large class sizes and bureaucracy challenging. Its focus on internships and career development provides practical experience, helping students thrive in both academic and professional pursuits. Overall, UF delivers a well-rounded education with numerous opportunities for personal and professional growth.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at the University of Florida has been incredibly rewarding. The vibrant, diverse campus life and strong academic programs, especially in the health sciences, stand out. The faculty is deeply invested in student success, and the interdisciplinary opportunities allowed me to broaden my skills. The campus is beautiful and environmentally conscious, while the Gator pride creates a strong sense of community, making every moment memorable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida has given me a plethora of opportunities and connections, and for that I am forever thankful. I do have issues with how the school handles student life, such as protests and student mental health crises. I also am unhappy with on-campus mobility, specifically reflected in the lack of parking for commuter students. I have had beautiful experiences within all of my classes and professors, though, and that cannot go unsaid.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have loved my time at the University of Florida and don't want it to end! I love the campus, school spirit, academics, involvement, nightlife, greek life, athletics, and safety!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My first week at University of Florida was great. It was good to meet new people and I am honestly looking forward to all my classes.  The professors seem genuinely interested in the students and have been very helpful.  The campus is great and easy to maneuver.  On campus, I travel by bicycle to the areas that are a greater distance.  I made initial effort to explore clubs to enhance my campus life and quickly discovered organizations that fall within my interests. I feel I’m getting a good start by joining two clubs and the possibility of a third club.  So far, UF has been a very good fit and I’m looking forward to a great year.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am not currently enrolled with the University of Florida, however I am very interested in applying to this college and I aspire to be Sports Medicine Physician through a Biology degree at this college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: When I first came to UF, I had no experience living on my own and did not have too many friends around campus. I was also living off-campus so it came with responsibilities such as finding my own ways for food and having to travel back and forth from classes on campus back to my apartment. However, the facilities provided by the university were extremely helpful, as they had multiple bus routes to go around town, they had food provisions on campus for those even without meal plans for a low rate, and had lots of resources if help was needed. This made it really easy to adjust and made making friends and meeting new peers easier as I had lesser things to worry about. Something that I would have liked to change however is the fact that during weekends it was extremely hard to go around town without a car as the bus routes barely run and it makes it quite difficult to get anywhere when in need of something. Overall though, coming to UF has been a great experience and I love it here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is  a Public Ivy!  First, the tuition is affordable for a great quality education.  The University has so many options, resources and contacts for students to create a path for success. There are in class and online options but both options offer a wonderful student life involvement.  Instructors and curriculum is progressive and offers multiple options.  Greek Life is amazing and happy with so many options available.  Dorm life is almost a Rite of Passage and it has been an amazing journey!  Go Gators!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far the university of Florida has been a good place. Everyone here is nice. On my first day everyone gave me a warm welcome. I have been having a good time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus life is pretty nice. You get to meet a lot of interesting people by walking around to classes and going to the gyms.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The spirit of the university and feeling like you have support from so many resources is amazing! I would like to see changes on how when you’re taking an asynchronous class that the people online would feel more included and less like a fly on the wall.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a first-year transfer student, I really appreciate how many on campus events are held for students to make friends. There are so many ways to get involved, not just through greek life. Your experience at UF is what you make of it, and I feel that it is truly a place where you get just as much out of it as you put into it. Adjusting to such independent living has been difficult, but there are so many resources here, and no one  has ever made me feel bad for being new or needing guidance. If there was one thing I would like to see changed are the limited amount of parking available on campus. The lack of space for the cars that are here make for frustrated drivers and in turn, unsafe driving habits. As a student who mostly walks everywhere, I would like to see more of a focus on traffic safety.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus of UF is very large there are multiple study areas that a student could access. I tried the food on campus once and saw that they did not much of a variety. One thing they could improve on is providing more health options. The campus is very walkable. Everything is mostly in a walkable distance if not there are bus and scooter.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have visited UF and want to attend there, all of the visits have been a great experience and I look forward to working hard to attend in the fall.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: At first the diversity isn't like other places in Florida like Orlando but it's not bad. You do see people who look like you every once in a while and the people are friendly.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is a very tight knight family community where all students follow their own successful paths while having fun with many great and free opportunities offered at the University of Florida. There are more than 1000 student organizations on campus and also can create organizations. Housing and residence life if great where dorms are close to campus but most need upgrades since most dorms are older. The food on campus is great especially when getting meal plans students are able to use flex bucks to pay for food outside if the dining halls in selected resturaunts. The campus life is really fun and enjoyable where their are many activities that students can socialize and make friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the football game atomsphere, just the hoops needed to be accpeted as well as tuition are outrageous. Otherwise I love the food options, close to grocery stores, in state, I just cant be too picky.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The University of Florida really became home to me shortly after I stepped on campus freshman year. Although my freshman year was cut short due to COVID-19, in that short year alone I knew that Gainesville was a new home for me.
Today I look back and realize the five short years I spent with the University, the surrounding city, and the people that make Florida the school I fell in love with. As a former student athlete competing in cross country and track and field, I was fortunate to experience both normal college life, and the rather tough but rewarding life of a Division I athlete. Despite all my ups and downs, and the long days trying to balance my athletic and personal life while keeping up in school, I would not trade my experience for the world. I have come to learn how strong ‘Gator Nation’ is and how much pride people have for my school, something I can happily say I have too.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love being a gator. The school spirit is unmatched. I love how much they promote academics, but also wellness and involvement. I am involved in Greek life at my school, and absolutely love it. UF offers great programs and opportunities all around for their students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Everyone has been encouraging and helpful.  I have made a lot of new friends.  My dorm hall has been great too
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I love the student life at the University of Florida. The school spirit is unlike anything I have ever experienced. Everyone is so passionate about our school, especially with sports. Every single sporting event I have attended, which is quite a few, has be exhilarating and just so much fun. I feel like the spirit and passion for the school really connects everyone. 
I would like to see better food at the dining halls. I feel like there are not many healthy options on campus. Many of the dining halls are very inconsistent with the food they saw they have. Also, the quality of the food is not very good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the University of Florida! Even for people that don’t like to party in college, there are so many other things to do and local places to explore. My professors were all accommodating and passionate about their work and I never felt too overwhelmed with courses. The only change is the parking, as this is very limited and not accessible for undergrads.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Public research university The University of Florida is situated in Gainesville, Florida. It's well-known for its competitive athletics and academic programs. They are regarded as one of the best universities in the country. They provide a large selection of programs. The engineering, business, legal, and medical schools of UF are its most well-known offerings. There is decent lodging on campus. I am forced to live in a classic type dorm since I live in Simpson Hall. I was concerned about the shared restrooms, but they seem to be in good condition right now. Because of the diversity of the student body, there is an inclusive environment that promotes creativity and teamwork. Furthermore, UF has a robust athletics program, as evidenced by the success of the Florida Gators in a variety of sports. The university's reputation is further enhanced by its research and community service.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida has allowed me to grow both professionally and personally during my time there so far. The College of Agricultural and Life Sciences within UF specifically has helped me to get involved in leadership and prepare well for my future academic plans.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I took a lot of really cool classes, had access to academic help when necessary, was able to double major and have full scholarship, mad lifelong friends, enjoyed the environment of being on campus, had some really thoughtful professors
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF offers a nice balance between strong academics and a social life. The campus is large, but walkable. There are hundreds of different clubs for students to join.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Just more outreach since it's a very big school it's easy to get lost. Also maybe help advisors more to have a good feel for the classes and professors that they're recommending to students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would not hesitate attending University of Florida again. I was a full-time, out of state student for my full four year undergraduate degree and thoroughly enjoyed the challenging academic courses and lively campus life. The athletics, club sports, and fundraising organizations create an active environment and produce a healthy and contagious winner's mentality around campus. The endless opportunities the university and student body offers is irreplaceable and creates a home for everyone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The education standards are really high and there is an issue with some professors in making their policies clear with the class, but overall, a lot of the teachers that I have had really do care about the performance of their students and try their best to help them succeed despite many of the large class sizes. 
The athletics is something I quickly came to appreciate at the university. We have a lot of great athletes playing for the college to cheer and the morale amongst the other students in supporting those student athletes is almost always through the roof. Their intramural and club sports are phenomenal too. Depending on the sport, some of the club team are tougher than others, but the club teams are constantly making the school proud. Intramural teams are my favorite, however, and the university and RecSports staff do an amazing job of organizing and facilitating intramural events for the individual and team sports offered.
I really appreciate the many opportunities UF offers.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's pretty good here so far. Dining hall food is surprisingly nicer than I thought. Always someplace around campus to sit. Can't go 2 steps without there being a chair of some kind. A good chunk of the buildings do look the same so there's that but it's still a nice looking campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love most all the classes +my professors who are all genuinely passionate. I like that UF is super affordable for me and many others, which leads to quite the diverse student body. Admin is frustrating especially with recent laws going into place throwing the future of certain clubs and courses up into the air. Gainesville itself is okay but only if you have a car.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a good school, course workload is insane sometimes but most of the teachers seem to really care about what they are teaching. On the downside, it is somewhat difficult to get in contact with your advisors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Have not been there for a while, starting in a week, but campus of beautiful and professors are helpful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida has a beautiful campus and amazing opportunities for students of every kind. Professors are helpful and engaging, there are plenty of extracurricular opportunities, and diversity among the student body is high.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the University of Florida. It is a great school. Local area is great, campus is great, athletics are wonderful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at the University of Florida will be some of the best times I will have in my life. From going to the Gator football games to a seemingly endless array of clubs and organizations to choose from, this University has changed me for the better. I've got to explore and deepen my passion for filmmaking with my Media Productions major, along with connecting with those who share that same passion. I love seeing how busy areas of campus are, like Turlington Plaza or the Plaza of the Americas, where I can truly experience that "university" feeling, seeing thousands of kids walk to class, lay in the grass, or try to get people to join their club. This university has opened my eyes to new experiences and new friendships that will last a lifetime, and I am filled with the same excitement and optimism I had when I first enrolled in this school. I can't wait for what comes next in my collegiate career with the University of Florida, and I can't express enough gratitude for this school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall looks pretty good and loads of things to do around the campus. Good food shops around the campus as well but I mainly use my meal plan.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university of Florida is one of the best colleges to attend. The professors and staff are all very professional and only there to see you succeed, yet they do not shy from challenging you. The students here are incredible as well, all being top students and overall very friendly. The campus is gorgeous and connected very well; you really feel as if you’re on campus and enclosed when you are going to classes or walking around.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the variety of programs offered at this university as well as the amount of help given to you when needed to sign up for classes as a new student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the UF campus life!  It has been a great experience. It is challenging and the social life is very good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF is the perfect college town, and your experience is really what you make of it. I love the dining places near campus, the easy and free access to public transportation, and most of all, I like that you can walk around campus safely. Greek life is really big at UF, but even if you are not a part of it, there are so many ways to be involved and plenty of chances to grow both personally and academically. I cannot wait for my full college experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: With any college, in general, it is what you make it out to be. Specifically, at the University of Florida, there are many opportunities to meet new and different people, but you do have to put yourself out there. While UF may not be located in a tourist attraction city, there is plenty to do and many places nearby to have fun. For instance, there is a lot of nature that you can appreciate, including springs and state parks. There are also vintage and farmer's markets on the weekends too! UF also offers free admission to students to our very own Lake Wauburg where you can partake in many outdoor and water recreational activities. Further, there are many resources and organizations to help you with almost anything. Whether you want to find a community or need services, such as counseling, we most likely have a place for you! Lastly, and most importantly, we have great and challenging academics for students to learn and prosper in their future endeavors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I came to University of Florida with not that friends. I made it a point to meet new people, especially asian individuals. I grew up in an area that did not have a large asian community. Due to that, I had a very weird relationship with my ethnicity. But coming to the university of Florida has allowed me to meet new people which I will always be grateful for. There is nothing that I would change about the University of Florida.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked how many opportunities there are and how much is going on. There's always something to do around campus, and the student life there is really thriving. There are a lot of communities you can get involved in. The only part I don't love is how expensive the area is, it is a bit hard to afford without financial aid.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I attend the University of Florida Jacksonville campus for nursing and I enjoy the professors and their help to actually want you to succeed. The campus is held at the hospital and I love how everything is in the proximity.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF has great academics, but they are NOT easy!! I went in and almost felt like I should’ve known more than I did, even though I graduated top of my class and with an Associates degree in high school. Gainesville is a nice little town but it is not overly quiet, many instances regarding safety occurred my first year and therefore I am overly cautious. Overall, UF is a good school and I do feel like I am getting a great education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is a great school for online students. I am a student in the Fire and Emergency services program and have enjoyed my time here. Although I am an out of state student, the tuition rates for this school are more affordable than an in-state institution where I live in Tennessee. Also, the academics are sufficiently challenging. The professors that I've had have all been very helpful, welcoming calls or emails. There are a few programs noted for their fire science across the nation, such as Oklahoma State University but they are so much more costly. Another great aspect of being an online student at University of Florida is being treated like an on-campus student. You have access to all campus facilities, can purchase Florida Gators football student season tickets, etc. While many "colleges" that cater to fire and emergency services are basically degree mills and lack the reputation that the University of Florida offers. UF has instant name recognition.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had an amazing overall experience at the University of Florida. I am exceptionally pleased with both my academic and personal experience as a Gator. While the classes have proven to be very challenging, it is also a very rewarding environment that makes you want to be a better student. The school spirit is amazing and there are plenty of things to do around the college town to have fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience with UF has been both demanding and fulfilling. I value the academic rigor which has allowed me to grow as an individual as well as a student. The availability of social resources and career growth/development opportunities is also something I've come to appreciate during my time here. Something I would like to see improved is the availability of classes. I have had difficulties selecting courses that are essential to my degree because of the lack of availability, even in online spaces.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the University of Florida. They have a little bit for everyone! They have thousands of clubs, Greek life, rec sports, and so many options for food. It is also very affordable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have just been accepted to the University of Florida as a transfer student. While I have not been in classes yet, I really enjoyed the campus, and the overall vibe that University of Florida gave. Everyone I have spoken to loves UF and recommends anyone to receive their education there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: There were many new people from different backgrounds who I met and learned new things from. The workload wasn't that bad as long as you could manage your time properly. Overall a great experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a freshman here at the University of Florida for the summer B semester, I find that there is not much student life happening around campus after the first week of the semester. There are little to no events where you can meet people, or at least nothing is very advertised, so not many people know about the events that are going on. The few events that have been hosted, though, were interesting and had some fun and exciting aspects to them, for example, there was one night where they had freshwater oysters that you could choose from and have the pearl taken out and put into a necklace to take home. The dining hall food is not great, it slowly decreases in quality throughout the semester and the menus they put online are inaccurate at times, but the other retail places on campus are not too bad. The one thing I love about campus is how beautiful it is and how many study spots, benches, and community areas there are. Overall it's a good university thus far and enjoy the community!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is an amazing school where each students have tons of opportunities. There are a variety of clubs and organizations that enhance your college experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: No issues as an out of state graduate online student. The application process was seamless, the admissions team and advisors have been helpful and insightful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: If you're looking for a school that's going to give you the best education, UF is the place for you. I won't lie, it can be very difficult sometimes, but passing and getting good grades is possible. If you're dedicated to your future, you'll do so well at UF. If you ever need a break and need social interaction, there's plenty to do, but not to much to do to the point where you'll get distracted. Go Gators!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Loved the people, the campus is beautiful, and loved the atmosphere, especially on game days. Some classes are harder than others but still appreciated support systems, and clubs offered are great because so many of them are offered at different times
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've loved UF thus far. There are so many opportunities to get involved on campus, which can be daunting at first, but is perfect for someone wanting to become a small fish in a big pond. I am continually inspired by my peers to reach for the stars--I've grown in so many ways since my freshman fall. I'm eternally grateful for the challenges I've faced, whether that be obtaining the right courses, taking "weed outs", or getting rejected from a student organization. Each experience has left me with invaluable life experience. That said, the environment is competitive but (generally) supportive; I would only recommend to people who are certain they can deal with periods of high stress.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have never felt more at home than I did at UF. That being said, the experience is what you make of it. I tried my best to go out, meet people, and have fun during my first year there. I have made some lifelong friendships and have learned so much more than academics. The people are amazing and the school is one of the best in the country. I would like to see upgrades in the older dorms and the food is very much in need of an upgrade. My teachers have been pretty good so far and I have enjoyed my experiences at the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is a great university to go to. The academics are of high quality and professors are great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I haven't started classes at UF, but I have visited the university a few times to take tours, and I am always amazed by the university life that UF offers. Students who were already enrolled told me that academic and social life are really good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: While I am a commuter student at the University of Florida, I still get a lot out of being there. I've enjoyed the psychology courses I've taken.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF is an amazing place to be that will challenge you academically but will also allow you to have fun and ejoy everything college life has to offer.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, UF has giving me the experience I needed to not only grow as a student but as a person. I have been able to hold many leadership positions that have opened many doors for me in other areas. Also this campus has given me long lasting friendships that I have cherished forever.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF has great academics, connections, career preparation options, and student life for a comparably low price.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF has a great community and diverse opportunities. It is a great place to explore yourself and meet new people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
In my short time at the University of Florida, I have had a stellar experience. Despite being a fully online student for the first three semesters, I have been able to thoroughly enjoy campus life to its full extent. I have actively been on campus, going to sporting events, and participating with classmates in on-campus life. 
I have absolutely adored going to sporting events and being a part of standard college life. The atmosphere of being around fellow students while cheering for the Florida Gators in football, baseball, softball, or basketball. I also frequently go to the library to study on campus. Since I live off-campus and only take online classes (for the time being), being able to participate and feel like a normal college student is a feeling that has been so unbelievably important to me over the past few semesters.
There are a handful of things that I do want to see changed, however. There is a lot of construction on campus that needs to be finished as soon as possible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have enjoyed my time at UF, it is a big community with everything surrounding campus life and Gator sports.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Haven’t really bee on on campous for long. It’s a school that take academics well and it has a huge college town so you will no doubt find your crowd. It is a college town so some things are far away. But it is Florida so at the end of the day nothing is truly that far away, just a bit out of reach.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked the University of Florida it's a good school to go for an education with a nice campus and good professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: OVerall UF is a very good school. However, it is also a very prestigious insititution and is consequently very rigorous. Mainting such high standards means that there is a significant amount of pressure on students and a fair amount of "weed out" courses. UF in some cases feels like it does not care much about its students in respect to supporting their academic goals, it is very much a "make it or break it" mindset. However, as mentioned it is a good school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is well balanced in its academics, athletics, and social environment. There are organizations available for any interest imaginable. However, there is an underlying competitive atmosphere in many departments and on campus construction caused some mess during the time I was there. Overall, it was a great experience that had its strengths and I would recommend it to anyone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My overall experience at the University of Florida is enriching, i was able to immerse myself in the variety of clubs they offer. I was also able to partake in the tennis club
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF was a great experience. The academics and student life are great. There's not much diversity, but you're able to find your group pretty easily.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Some of the untraditional programs can be very limiting and not a lot of opportunities to try a diverse amount of courses. I enjoyed everything except this about the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Florida is an amazing school, with so many career opportunities. It truly feels like a public Ivy league school. The culture of the school is prestigious and they hold their students to a high standard.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My experience with the University of Florida (UF) has been quite positive overall. UF is known for its strong academic programs and rigorous standards which is one of the main reasons I chose to attend. 
The campus is vibrant, offering over 1,000 student organizations, academic clubs, cultural organizations, sports, or the arts, there is something for everyone. UF benefits from a mix of urban and natural environments, the city is a friendly, college-town vibe and plenty of outdoor activities, cultural events, and a warm climate. However, there are areas for improvement. Some introductory courses can be quite large, making it challenging for students to get individual attention. Streamlining academic advising will be very beneficial. Parking is one of the largest problems too because it is very difficult to find a spot and lots of fines to go around.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: There is something for everyone at the University of Florida. As an introvert, I thought I would get lost in a sea of chaos, but that wasn't the case at all. If you push yourself to come out of your shell, you'll learn rather quickly that there are so many other people who are in the exact same position. Go Gators!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Florida is an amazing college for anyone from academic focused students to athletic minded ones. There is no shortage of opportunities on campus to further your goals and get involved with your student community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoy attending the University of Florida. Something I enjoy the most would be the school spirit and opportunities and something I dislike would be the ongoing construction.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: To be a Florida Gator is such an amazing experience. It's an amazing environments for students that thrive academically and love to get involved in their school. The extracurricular opportunities are unmatched, and the support system for students who want to be as involved and academic as possible is immaculate.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF is an amazing university which offers a wide range of clubs, extracurricular activities, jobs, and courses for whatever interest a person may have. The libraries are amazing and they have embedded a Starbucks in the Marston's and Library West libraries. The only downside of UF is its construction along the university, however, it is great to see the university growing and adding more buildings for students to further succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: In my opinion, the University of Florida, per se, is a good school. By that I mean, I have experienced and read articles writing about the development and bettering of UF. How especially in Finance and Accounting, UF has achieved a top level education. However, given the location of the small college town in Gainesville, there are not much to do. I do certainly agree that the springs were beautiful and is filled with nature. However, as a person who likes indoors and cooler temperatures, the nature aspect is not enough to overlook the inconsistent weather, the lack of entertainment buildings/areas, the poor quality restaurants, and the lack of transportation. Although, I would mention, growing up in Japan, my expectation of a functional city is much different than that of an American person. Yet, I would still strongly argue, with more entertainment centers, small malls, places for friends to hangout, with a transportation system to go to them, would strongly benefit Gainesville.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is a great institution for students who want to pursue an associate, bachelor's, or any higher education degree. Ranked as the #1 public university in the nation, the University of Florida offers a wide array od degrees, extracurriculars, sports, and clubs. the University of Florida is a university you will never forget!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have loved all of the different student organizations that students can get involved with at the University of Florida. My college experience would not be the same without becoming part of organizations such as American Marketing Association, where I have had the chance to grow in leading, selecting and recruiting people and clients, and selling myself to future employers. I have also enjoyed Gator Christian Life, where I have had the opportunity to grow closer in my relationship with God and connect with like-minded individuals. During my time here at UF, I have enjoyed watching the sports games as the students are really invested in our team unlike most schools. I would like to see more safety put in place off-campus as there are lots of homeless people that hang around. I also would like for more food options so that students are not forced to go to dining halls, especially at late hours when most locations are closed. Dining halls should also cook their food so it is not raw.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I went to UF from 2018-2022 and enjoyed my experience. I was involved in volunteer and extracurricular groups as well as in a fraternity on campus. My major had many challenging courses and I found that my Gen Ed classes were much more difficult to succeed in than classes specific to my Applied Physio and Kinesiology major. The professors in my major were caring, attentive to detail and very helpful as we faced the Covid pandemic beginning my sophomore year. I struggled in particular with the way larger classes were handled (i.e. physics 1&2 and all of the chemistry courses/labs). Academic advising was not as strong as I had hoped and I ended up having to withdraw from one class and take a semester longer than I had planned to due to this oversight. Overall, I am proud to be a “Gator Grad” and would happily return to my alma mater for grad school if offered a seat.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Everything was excellent! One of the best schools in America. Out of state tutoring was expensive but tuition was cheap and low. Best school in Florida, when comparing to UCF, USF, FSU, FIU, or UM. In the top 200 schools in the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I mean its cool i like it to be honest the reason why i like it here is because i have a nice roommate and i just love it here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The idea of being in a class so grand, without knowing anyone in a new city and environment would be hard on anyone, yet the campus invites you in while having a student body so welcoming. Each student understands the work you have previously put in and respect your journey, which leads to becoming close as the road ahead will be harsh and will be filled with rewards. The dorm space is an interesting first year interaction that can be recommend to all as being away from home can be harsh if to be left alone, so having someone or a group around you grants peace of mind with your environment. Although the showers can be seen as an issue, the work load and path ahead points you to disregard those minor bumps to a future for you to expand upon and any resources needed are given to you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely loved and appreciated the ever-present school spirit that the school, professors, and students showed every day (it is one of the things I will miss most as a recent graduate). I also liked the amount of opportunities available to students for career building, studies, and extracurriculars. What I would like to see change, however, is the parking situation on campus, as it is difficult to find parking spots during early school day hours.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would to see more diversity in students and educators. It’s believe policy by the Florida Governor on Diversity and inclusion has really impacted the University in a negative way.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Gainesville and all that the university has had to offer. I love and am proud to be a gator, I do wish that there was less of a 'sink or swim' mentality and there was more guidance help to support.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF has been an awesome experience! I’m a transfer student and have only had positive experiences with professors, advisors, and other students. There are so many ways to get involved and every person I’ve met has been incredibly nice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love being a student at UF. I have had so many amazing professors and made great friends. Campus feels very safe and easy to get around for the most part. The culture of the school is welcoming and fun, and the area is great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Whether you are taking online classes or on campus classes, the University of Florida offers everything you could want in a college experience. From dorms the allow you the comforts of living to amenities around the area to keep you entertained. From the partying to the education, there is greatness all around.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing undergraduate institution and despite what others may say… I love Gainesville. Loved it so much I’m going back for more schooling with UF COM!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved UF! They're really building up Butler Plaza so there's a lot more stores/ things to do there. Most of the professors are great. I only have one really bad one. Academics wise I felt like the classes were fair. Campus was nice, hopefully the construction is almost done though.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Being such a large university, two different people would be unlikely to respond to this survey the same way. The school provides so many options for academics, campus involvement, and social life. As a freshman, I really enjoyed how easy the school made it for freshman to interact with other freshman. I was able to find many friends through these pathways, however I feel like there is definitely a fall off after the first year. This might just be because the school is so big and cannot accommodate activities for all of its students, however I definitely think that morale among students is highest during their freshman and senior years.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF offers so much opportunity to grow professionally no matter what field you are in. Besides its long-standing great reputation that already puts your name on the map, the university goes above and beyond for its colleges to have events such as career fairs to ensure that students have all the resources they need. I also admire the sustainability efforts that UF strives to achieve and the accomplishments they already have in having numerous LEED-certified buildings. I love how involved students are because it is a constant inspiration to get involved and make a difference on campus. I would like to see a change in DEI commitments, and less student fees for things like football games and on-campus concerts. I also would like more 24-7 hours for campus libraries or other study spaces. Campus transportation like SNAP should also be consistently improved upon.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love Gainesville, it is much like my home town of Kalamazoo Michigan. I moved to Gainesville from Michigan out of high school to transfer to UF once I finished 2 years at Santa Fe College.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed the atmosphere of the University of Florida, and the vibrant student body. I also enjoyed the natural scenery surrounding the city of Gainesville.
