There are plenty of extracurriculars to encourage students to be involved in campus activities. There are limited food options on campus for UF students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love it entirely. Living close to students that have similar interests is definitely the best part about living on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing school. Has many academic resources for whenever exam season comes along. Very helpful professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Although it is a fairly large university, UF was fantastic because despite its size, it gave unlimited resources and opportunities to develop a great sense of community and belonging.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The athletes and Greek life made up the university of Florida for entertainment purposes. Outside of that there isn’t much except parks and museums. The professors were generally really good with a few bad eggs but I had a wonderful experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida, located in a small friendly town with many activities for students to take part in, whether recreational or night life.  Many of the building are styled in old brick architecture, and for some areas are beginning to phase out asphalt roads for walkable paths.  My only concerns with it involve it being a research school, so many professors aren't well trained for the classroom environment and sometimes show a form of disinterest, and the city is planning to remove many of the public bus transportations.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Im a admitted student but not sure going to where. personally it's one of my best picks I think, especially the beach and low tuition compared to other schools
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: At UF, as a physics major, my roommate Sven adds to the dorm's coziness. The food is decent, and I enjoy the vibrant party scene biweekly. I engage in kayaking at Lake Alice, climbing at The Knot, and utilize the gym facilities. People initially seem similar, but finding a fitting clique through clubs is easy. While the campus isn't the prettiest, UF offers a fulfilling experience overall.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is amazing! The culture here is very "work hard, play hard." The classes are rigorous and the students are very ambitious and involved in many organizations. Greek Life and partying is also pretty big here. Sports are huge -- football and tailgating especially! The city itself (Gainesville, FL) is a small college town, which is really fun! Overall, I made the best decision coming to UF and highly recommend it!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My time at the University of Florida has been one full challenges and rewards. While UF may be more known for it's nice night life and party scene, the professors and student body are truly the main reasons as to why UF is such an amazing place to attend college. The professors are kind, understanding, and willing to help you if you reach out to them. As for the students, everyone here is generally happy and outgoing. Generally, UF is a great university and if you're considering attending, definitely put this at the top of your list.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is a great school if you are looking to expand your knowledge and challenge yourself. You are able to make professional connections, challenge your education skills, and be able to succeed. This is a very do it yourself university when it comes to courses and learning. However, there are many resources in order to help out in your courses.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm currently a student at the University of Florida as an upcoming sophomore. This being my first year here, I'm surprised by how much this school has to offer. There are many clubs and organizations that cater to the individual needs of students. It may be hard to make friends at first, but once you become more open to meeting new people, it becomes easier. The academics are difficult, but that's what makes this school one of the best in Florida.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think that UF is truly an everything school. You can find a party culture, athletic culture, as well as a strong focus on academics. There are plenty of opportunities available to students as long as they are willing to put in the work and look for them.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the various opportunities that UF provides for its students. However, I believe they can be better at supporting students and guiding them through these opportunities. As well as increase the diversity as well as diversity resources in the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the University if Florida my time here as been amazing, all the professors I've taken have been very welcoming at supportive. My advisor is also extremely supportive and caring towards her department.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is the premiere combination of academic rigor, student involvement, and student life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed my experience overall. The professors are fantastic. I think the administration should become more stringent on student safety.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the University of Florida. The professors here and excellent and extremely available. Furthermore, all faculty and staff truly care about students and want to see them succeed. Gainesville is a great town and a nice place to start being independent.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a current freshman at UF, I really enjoyed my time here so far. The academics here are taken seriously and prepare you well for your future career, though some courses are unnecessarily difficult. However, every professor I've had has been wonderful and added to my experience here. While I don't engage much with the party scene here, other student involvement such as clubs and events are super fun and a great way to get to meet people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am only halfway through my bachelor's degree, but I absolutely love UF and would recommend it to anyone who is considering attending.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I attended as a Class of 2022 transfer student, so I attended from August 2020 until August 2022. My junior year (Fall 2020-Spring 2021) was completely virtual due to Covid, so I was only focused on my coursework in my hometown which was great. My senior year was partly on campus which was academically great, but student life in Gainesville, especially as a transfer student, was less than pleasant due to the remote location of Gainesville. My final semester was in DC for an internship provided by the school which was great. If you are interested in a degree in international relations or foreign policy, there are better schools such as FIU which is also in Florida, but UF still grants an incredible education, although not exactly tailored to what I want to study nor where I want to live.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Going to the University of Florida has not been a decision I've regretted. Generally, student life is good, there is always something to do either through a student organization or nearby. UF is academically rigorous and for the most part the professors are pretty good and care about students more than you would expect. Campus feels pretty safe, I do not feel in danger when walking through campus alone late night. I would like to see more student voices heard in campus policy.  The quality of food in the dining halls should be better for what meal plans cost, there have been many times where the food served was not safe to eat (spoiled salad bar items, pink chicken, etc).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked how clean the campus was. It had beautiful scenery everywhere I went and everyone there was helpful. One thing I would like to see change is more places to show where I'm going.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Processors are giant jerk babies, they don't teach, they report anything to staff and waste students’ time and ruin students’ life. The problem is not online class, but the online class use old problematic videos and exams can clearly show the date as three years ago. It's just a money maker machine for faculties to play the game of power. I don't know how they got the 11:1 ratio when graduate class normally contain 300+ students in STEM major. There is no support and nobody listens to students, classes are too big to be called as class since most contain a teaching group which means one processor teaches one chapter, and they have even bigger TA group. It's awful! And it is worse than many many community colleges.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I go to school at the citylab campus which is very small and in downtown Orlando. I have had a wonderful experience. The professors are very passionate and the class sizes are small so you get a more personal experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoyed the more low-key part of living in Gainesville. While campus is teeming with life, the surrounding area consists of a lot of niche areas, there's something for everyone. Personally, the nature areas, state parks, and botanical gardens were a great place for me to relax and take photography. Campus itself was also great, with beautiful architecture, and there's plenty of student life with countless opportunities to find a group of students with similar interests through various clubs and organizations. I would without a doubt go back for graduate school given the chance.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like how welcoming all of the students are and how you can quickly become friends or find something in common with everyone. I would say some of the professors are not the best at teaching since they will either read straight off of a slide or go off track.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love it but...They should change the acceptance rate to be more accessible and less competitive, considering how most students who get in are mostly by chance instead of merit. Along with reducing the overall costs charged by the college. They keep making it harder to get in but increase the price of admissions. However, one is to assume that a very selective university with many competitive applicants would have a very smart student body; nope a lot of the campus make themselves look like they don't even go there do to their attitudes not aligning itself with the extremely difficult entry. Ultimately, UF should increase their rate of acceptance while also not running off a lottery system, rather they should remark for merit (athletics isn't merit).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the environment here and how there is a place for everyone to find their people and their niche.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoy the school and my program itself but not a huge fan of the area and have felt unsafe at many times.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is a fantastic school with diverse clubs. Some professors are okay, but some professors are great at what they teach. The curriculum is challenging, considering UF is a top 30 school nationwide. However, it is doable if you put in the time and work. I have made many friends at UF, including two close friends. UF is a great place to know who you are and become a better you while exploring new things that you might not have liked before.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: They have many ways and opportunities for you to get involved and provided  the resources for you to be successful such as free tutors. Due to it’s diversity your able to meet people of different backgrounds and cultures which in my opinion provides a safe space for you to be yourself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the welcoming the people are about in the University of Florida. I would like to see more diversity in the student body. I would also like to see more affordable housing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's an amazing college. Academics are very hard but if you apply yourself you will excel and learn a lot. There's lots of different clubs and organizations to join to find like minded individuals. Overall, it was an amazing experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am incredibly grateful to be attending this university. I am studying my passions, from anatomy & physiology to microbiology and medicine. There are immense opportunities for engagement, clubs, volunteering, etcetera. I have enjoyed my time here so far, and am looking forward to what my future here holds.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Florida is a wonderful experience for any student from all backgrounds. The University has so many different groups and opportunities for students to join and find their people. Also going out is easy and relaxed they have 18+ an 21+ bars and clubs. No car is required in order to get around and campus itself is very safe.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had a great experience at the University Of Florida. I have gotten involved and that has helped me a lot.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UF is a school full of great professors and people overall. It is pretty big, and quality control on the scale that it must be managed on. Because of this, there is always improvement occurring around campus. There is currently a new dining hall being constructed, and renovations being done on many existing buildings. The classes are a bit difficult to get into as a freshman, but as you progress, you will have higher chances of getting your top-choice times, etc. There is almost always a game going on, and they are a lot of fun to attend. The academics aren't terribly difficult, but some struggle more than others. It's a very well-rounded school that has something for just about everyone; you just need to be able to find it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have enjoyed my experience at UF. The majority of professors are kind and care for their students. I do think that the hiring/training process of academic advisors could be improved. A lot of the time it feels as though these advisors, especially in the engineering college, don't care much for their students. The classes are challenging, but in an enjoyable way
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have really enjoyed my experience at the University of Florida so far. It's been my dream school since I moved to Florida in fourth grade, and so far it has met all of my expectations. The classes are challenging and although some of my classes are of varied sizes, I do feel like my professors care about my well-being and success in my college experience. My biggest challenge comes from learning how to adequately study for each of my classes, especially since every teaching style and exam structure is so different. Without a shadow of a doubt, my favorite part of being a student here is the culture. The people, the atmosphere, and the resources available to me have made my college experience an extremely positive one so far, and I am excited to continue to discover the ways I can grow here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: This was an overall good experience. I learned a lot and met lots of interesting people. I really liked many of my courses, and the campus was beautiful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked my classes that were in person - online felt like not much of an education at all. I would like to see a stronger mental health services placed in the campus system and more interpersonal advising.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Located in Gainsville it's the heart of the “Gator Nation,” the University of Florida offers the best educations in the nation. Students are proud to attend and the community so kind with a large alumni network. UF offers so many scholarship and student aid opportunities while also have a diverse and welcoming campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked the campus, professors, and resources that the university offers, I would like to see them offer more scholarship opportunities
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The enjoyment of classes heavily depends on the professor and how they set up their class. That being said, I have had great experiences in certain classes and have loved the material, while others have been very unenjoyable and lackluster. Many parts of the campus are beautiful and kept clean, except for most dorms. Most dorms definitely need renovations and deep cleans since many of them are old. Although I am pointing out negatives, there are good aspects of the school. There are plenty of good communities to connect, as well as many events to go to.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I wouldn't know much about the Greek life at UF, however I do find it absolutely stupid that some friend had to skip some of their classes due to rushing!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are a huge part of the Gator lifestyle. Without them, UF wouldn't be the same.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is pretty big on UF's campus and they host a lot of events. They are a big part of student government and do a lot for the community. Most of the girls that I've encountered have been really nice great people!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The Gator Nation has a great respect for and support of our Gator athletics. It doesn't matter the sport from basketball to gymnastics everything is held in high regard and we have good teams for almost everything. Football gamedays are usually the most widely appreciated though as the entire campus comes together and overtakes campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: This is probably biased because I don't like Greek Life, but it's a huge part of campus life. You never go a day without seeing several people wearing their fraternity/sorority shirt, and their attitudes are generally cliquey and snobby. I live across from frat row and every night, there's a party. Literally every night, I hear music blaring from one of the frat houses. You have to wonder if they're actually getting anything done academically.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are probably the staple of this school. Everything revolves around football. Game day is the biggest day of the week.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greeks run the school, they favor each other, so if you're not greek getting a position in Student government, and other major organizations on campus is pretty much never going to happen.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Athletes are very much "taken car of." A good chunk of our tuition is solely used for sports and the athletes on scholarship.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Its really good if its something you're interested in. Some people prefer not to join in on them, but there's plenty of other things for them to do.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The school's spirit is great, everyone attends football games and the atmosphere is wonderful.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The first year for the Greeks is probably the worst
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Other students love sports, I'm not a huge fan.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I am not a part of Greek life but I know a lot of my friends are and they really seem to be enjoying themselves so good for them. I guess it just feels good to be a part of something right from the beginning of the school year.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't care much for athletics but I know football is huge at the University of Florida so I go with it. The fan spirit is truly amazing and it feels so good and makes you feel like something big. It is nice to see everyone come together when it comes to sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Don't really care, know a few girls in sororities but am here for school.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: As a DL student, Greek life does not have any impact or relation to my school experience.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: School spirit is readily apparent from the first time you step on campus, and alumni are constantly engaged.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I like to attend Greek parties at the fraternities my friends are in.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I'm an athlete and also attend other sporting events.  The football team sucks but I enjoy swimming and watching track and volleyball.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I only give Greek Life a low rating because it is polarizing and manipulative. Students are strongly encouraged to join Greek Life not only for the opportunities they offer but mostly because there is a stigma around not being involved in Greek Life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: School spirit and fan support are high for the football team but significantly lower for the less advertised but still fantastic "other" sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Haven't become part of one but I heard the Greek life is amazing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The sports are a big part of UF. Students are very proud of their teams. I believe the football team is one of the best in the country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The UF football team is amazing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I do not personally know much about Greek life, but Greek life is just viewed as another student organization.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is nothing like the experience of Gator sporting events. The best are the football games and all the traditions make it more special. All the sports are a big part of campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek life gives you a instant family and a new way to ale friends. There involvement in community activities and social events is incredible and gives you a sense of belonging and purpose.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: My brother plays football for the gators so I am a little biased. But I can tell you that my friends don't have brothers who play for the Gators and they are just as passionate as I am.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Although I am not a member nor have tried to be a member, I have heard from many girls currently rushing that the process is extremely biased and unorganized. Many of the girls have noted how picky the Greek life sororities are and how they seem to be biased in looking for a specific type or person.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The athletic opportunities at the University of Florida are some of the greatest in the Country. The range of activities students have to opportunity to participate in is vast and incorporating of all different interests and activity levels. From RecSports to club sports, to the gym facilities, to the fitness classes, to intramurals, students are encouraged to get active and have fun with athletics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is an important factor at UF. Almost 50% of students participate in it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: You are not a Gator until you have attended a Florida football game.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't have much experience with Greek Life
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I don't really have much experience with sports
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Personally, I chose not to take the Greek life route. It isn't really my scene. I wanted to focus on other things. The fraternities and sororities do a ton of fun activities together, but they don't really interact with any non-Greek life students. There's no tension or anything, they just kind of stay in their own bubble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I can't even describe the shock of electricity that ran through my veins the first time I stood in the Ben Hill Griffin stadium with my fellow Gators. It was louder and more exciting than any concert or other sporting event I have ever been to.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is very apparent on campus and very involved. While you don't have to be a part of a fraternity to be involved, you definitely will if you join one.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Here at the University of Florida students are more than spirited. During game days the stadium is packed to the brim with excited fans, students and non-students alike, chanting and cheering.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life at UF made my transition from high school to college a hundred times easier. I found my best friends through Greek life, I found a home away from home, and I found my place at the University of Florida all thanks to my Greek organization.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The school spirit is phenomenal. Whether you spend your Saturdays in the Swamp cheering on the football team or spend your Tuesday nights playing intramural soccer, you will enjoy all of the facilities UF has to offer.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not exactly the best person to talk to about describing the Greek Life because I view it as frivolous and meaningless.  However, my attitude extends beyond that in pointing out that the fact that Greek Life is highly integrated into student government means that any policies passed have a pro Greek agenda.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Obviously the University of Florida has a good reputation when it comes to sports, and the complexes that students are allowed to utilize are state of the art.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I personally am not involved in Greek life due to the cost, but I think it's a great way to meet new people and be more involved on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Whether you're physically play a sport on campus or not, every student here has great school spirit and support for the athletic teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
The life of a Gator is to bleed orange and blue. 

Even the least athletic student gets caught up in sports. 

If you don't play, you definitely watch and support the teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is okay, It's not all revolving around their parties (as everyone believes to be true). They do other things, but it's  not that great either in that they don't really promote anything for the well-being of the community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The SW gym is one of the best gyms that I know personally, it's up to date with its equipment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I feel like everybody is very accepting when it comes to culture/religion/sexual orientation. You see many races as you walk on campus and it honestly feels like we all can express ourselves freely.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Greek students are highly involved in student life. They are viewed as party people but also do great things for the community
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: UF has the biggest school spirit I've ever seen.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I am not personally in greek life but all of my friends are and I think they are great. I just personally do not agree with the cost, but I think what they stand for is awesome. It is a great way to make friends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Game days for football are my favorite! We get so passionate here and everyone gets really into game day.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is a big part of UF
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The athletic facilities are impressive around campus
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Overall great parties: very friendly
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone is enthusiastic and appreciative
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Being that I am not Greek, I am currently indifferent to the effect Greek life has on your social life, however, I think Greek life does add to one's college experience for the better especially its' benefits for one's future endeavors.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: As mentioned in the previous section, the fan support and school spirit is the best at any SEC Division I school in the country!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Great way to meet new people and to network with people on campus for future leadership roles, community service, and similar academic interests.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: There is no better experience that going to a UF football game in the Swamp!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Do not know enough about it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I take advantage of all of the athletic facilities, they are great.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Many of the largest student run organizations are highly influenced and ran by Greek life or those involved with it. Dance Marathon is the largest student run organization in the country and it is run predominantly by students that participate in Greek life. Greek life encourages students to give back to the community and works to making the school better than when you first arrived. There are fraternity and sorority houses that room most members of the Greek organization.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Come on, we're gators. Come to the Swamp and find out for yourself.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I think our Greek life compares to any other school. Almost all of our sororities and fraternities have houses on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is lots of school spirit, especially for football
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There's no pressure to join a fraternity or sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am not really into the idea of greek life. From what I know frats are pushy and sororities are filled with snobby girls.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I do not know much about sports since that's not my area but gator football players are great. The games are intense and fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is huge at UF. They offer many opportunities to the students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Fantastic school spirit that is felt at every corner!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is somewhat cliquey at UF, but they do a lot of good with their philanthropy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: We have one of the best overall athletic programs in the country, due in large part to the incredible efforts of Jeremy Foley. It will be hard to replace a man who has done so much for the University of Florida in his time here. The University of Florida does have very good Football and Basketball programs, but what makes UF one of the best overall athletic programs in the country is the fact that we are very dominant in the sports that do not receive as much attention. We are consistently dominant in sports like softball, gymnastics, track and field, swimming and diving, and many more. This dominance in athletics translates to a strong school spirit amongst the many UF students who take pride in being Gators.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is a great amount of diversity
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The Florida Gators have a huge fan following and the students love to go to all sorts of sports games to support the teams. Gators have a lot of school spirit so you should probably wear orange or blue to games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I have never had the urge to join the Greek community and I don't regret it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics department at the University is incredible, from football to baseball, and the Gator nation unites for all sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The term "School Spirit" is redefined at the University of Florida.  This is Gator Nation and if you're passive about athletics, that is sure to change while you're at school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life somewhat runs the school. If you are not in the fraternity of sorority or in a lesser of the fraternity of sorority's you are looked down upon and can't be as involved or welcomed as you might want to be.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I have a lot of friends in the varsity sports teams and my friends and I also play intramural sports together. The support and involvement from the school around sports is a great way for students to interact with one another.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Not involved. Nothing against it. Most of them are great people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: the tier system for the greek life at our school is extremely harsh. I love being in a sorority but I hate the judgement I get from other greeks because I'm bottom tier.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone has a count down till games are back in the swamp on saturday's. It's nice going to a school where sports bring us all together, but we all know academics are important as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I have no interest in entering Greek Life, thus I am indifferent about the idea.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school becomes very lively during sport events and almost all students participate in said events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our campus is extremely diverse and you can meet minority or international students on nearly every spot on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek students throw a lot of crazy parties. Although Greek students aren't snobby, they tend to just mingle within their sorority or fraternity and not with non-Greek students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: School pride is centered around school Athletics. No matter what major you're in, you will be at the stadium on game day,
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is crazy big on campus. Walking around campus, it feels as if 1 out of every 3 or 4 students are a part of some type of greek organization. There's different kinds too. Not all fraternities and sororities throw parties every night like some other fraternities and sororities. There are some greek organizations that were made strictly to give students opportunities after they graduate but those still have the brotherhood of a normal greek organization.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Watching any sporting event at UF is an amazing experience. Purchasing season tickets to the football games is a MUST do before a student graduates. Tailgating before the games and then walking into the swamp is one of the greatest things to ever do on campus, if not the greatest. The football players are basically Gods on campus though. The basketball games are always fun too! The O'Connel center is now being redone but I'm sure it will still be as packed as it was last year. What makes the basketball games great too is that they're free!!! Every sporting event other than football is free to students. Sports is definitely a major part of the University of Florida and there's reason behind it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are positive and there are negatives. Yes they throw big parties but they can be somewhat exclusive of people. There is bigger concern over their influence in student government and campus politics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: IT'S GREAT TO BE A FLORIDA GATOR
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: it is more diverse than where I went to high school and more tolerant however there is still a lack of diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I honestly am not a part of greek life on campus. However, from friends that are a part of sorority, I have heard mixed reviews: some love it, others feel like the time commitment takes them away from their studies.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The support our athletes receive at our school is both genuine and wide-spread. We have great athletic facilities that prove beneficial for the athletes at our school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I believe Greek students are viewed by non-Greeks as just the same. Working individuals doing all they can to better our society.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Although I am a distance learner, I have seen many bumper stickers representing UFL and it's sports teams from Miami to Jacksonville.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not for everybody and that's okay. UF Greeks are doing their best to become more diverse, but it is still a work in progress.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The past few years Gator athletics have somewhat fallen off the mark in regards to football and basketball, however both programs are quickly on the rise. There are over 50 intermural sports for non-athletes to choose from that are just as competitive as the others. Let's just say Florida and sports go together like ice cream and cake!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greeks will every once in a while be at Turlington Plaza, a large area where most people hang out or walk through, and they will promote their frat or sorority. I don't think that Greeks are neither looked down upon or looked as "gods" by non-Greeks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our school is very spirited. The entire city is spirited. You go to Walmart or Publix and you see older generations and small children supporting our athletics programs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not currently in Greek life but I plan on rushing in the fall. Tons of my friends are in sororities and fraternities and they love it! As a girl it is easy to still have a social life without being in a sorority because you can still attend frat parties. As a boy not in a fraternity, having a social life is a lot more difficult. You cab't attend frat parties or events so you'll have to stick to the bar scene which can be pretty pricey after a while and a little boring if you are under drinking age. I definitely recommend going Greek for both boys and girls because it gives you a much larger social life and it's so much easier to hear about things going on.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: School spirit is huge here at The University of Florida! Game days are crazy and fun making the fall the best time of the year. On gamedays everyone is so welcoming and friendly and you all feel like one big gator family!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There's a not-so-good stigma about Greeks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The gyms are available for all students!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am part of Greek life and it is the best thing I have done in college. I have a family that I can go to for anything and we do everything we can to give back to the community. I also live in the house and it is super cheap and super convenient. If you are a male, and you want to be a part of social life, Greek life is the place to be.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: We have won a championship in something for as long as I can remember.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The Greeks are some of the worst people you could ever get to meet, but they can throw a fairly good party sometimes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It is easy to be involved in athletics here and UF offers great sports facilities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not part of Greek life, but most of the people I know who are in Greek life are fantastic.  They do philanthropy and are very involved.  Some really fit the stereotype, but overall, I don't have a problem with them.  The Greek housing is cool, but some look run down.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Gator Nation is amazing in its support for its own.  While I am not a huge sports fanatic, I appreciate the way that these athletes train, the way that students and fans rave about our team, and just the overall support and camaraderie that UF has.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Coming into UF I didn't have much of an opinion about Greek life, but seeing all the philanthropy they do and how they create lifelong relationships, connections, and opportunities, I am definitely planning on joining a sorority in the Fall of 2016! Go Gators!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Gator football games are special events that in my opinion, are bigger than an NFL game. With its spirited fans, school spirit, and amazing players, a Gator game definitely overrides the feelings of exhaustion due to the 95 degree heat.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is very cliquey. Most Greek life students are rude, do not respect property and are extremely loud.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: School spirit is tremendous, it is the complete opposite of my high school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not in the greek life but some of them are very snobby and think the world revolves around them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of support for the different sports teams available.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Some of the people in Greek life are great, but a minority ruin it for the others. Most people seem to outgrow it after the first couple of years anyway.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Football is huge here, but honestly I don't pay much attention to the sports in general besides a few games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is an ongoing issue that cause a rift between the student body. At the University of Florida there are so many students that it's not as big of a deal if you're not in Greek life. Although, many believe that Greek life is important in order to stay "cool" but really it's supposed to be about involvement on campus in with each organizations philanthropy. Greek life is supposed to be used to get to known others in a smaller environment and connect with people who are passionate about getting a team together for a fundraiser or showing support as a mass for a member on a sports team. While Greek life may include socials and events that alcohol is accompanied in, it's not the sole focus of the organization. Non-Greeks are fairly accepting of Greeks and we we able to associate with each other just fine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The amount of people that turn out for sporting events makes me happy I went to a big school. There's lots of people supporting each other and cheering players on. Of course football has a high following and attendance but even gymnastics, baseball, lacrosse, and soccer are enjoyed by many. I love that as students we can attended the sporting events for free other than football,l which the tickets are still reasonably priced.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The only reason why I gave diversity a 4 out of 5 is because of the inevitable majority of the students and faculty being white. Other than that UF is very diverse from student organizations to events that are all inclusive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is very big at UF, and is a great opportunity to become a part of a organization bigger than yourself.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: UF is incredibly competitive in a plethora of different sports, making it an intense center for school pride.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not a part of any fraternity, personally. However, I hear great things from those who are.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The entire revolves around gator athletics, especially Gator football. The games are some of the most energetic and spirited events I have ever witnessed.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek life on campus is very popular and provides a good image for the community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am a student athlete at the University of Florida and the amount of support and resources that are offered is amazing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you find the right fraternity or sorority, life can be really great for you. Use it to your advantage, don't just "pay for your friends."
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We not only have so much school spirit for our major sports, but intramurals and club teams also receive an immense amount of support and credit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life definitely plays a role in campus life however, it's more in the matter that they sponsor and take part in a lot of events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics at UF are among the best in the nation. Our facilities are state of the art and facilitate all who are interested in using them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am not a huge fan of the concept of greek life in general but I do think its presence is a little to prominent on campus, and I think it promotes incredibly unhealthy body images and lifestyle habits for many students specifically at UF.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I think that our athletic programs are incredibly strong. They truly help unite the entire student body as some people make the programs great, and everyone else supports them together tying us all in to be one big family.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have a smaller community in a huge school
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Nothing like a UF tailgate & football game!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Being involved in Greek Life, I can definitely say that I love my organizations and all it has to offer. However I just wish the rest of the campus would see the same thing. I would rate it higher if every side was impartial.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't have anything to really compare the overall experience, but I from what I've seen this school is top in many areas of athletics and has major school spirit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics at any SEC school can be fun and exciting. But the University of Florida really comes to life around sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's great to be a Florida Gator!!!!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's okay; typical of what you see in movies
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school spirit is outrageously active. They even have a club dedicated for attending sporting events (the Rowdy Reptiles).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People get excited about Gator Nation for a reason!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Go Gators! Football games are really big, and so are other sports. You need to buy football tickets, but other sports are free for students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of campus events are centered around Greek Life. The student government is also decided on by Greeks because they are usually forced to vote for one side. Some Greek students are great and others aren't. Usually people don't judge just because someone is in a Greek. I don't know much about Greek Life, but I believe there is housing available to upperclassmen.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Many students are involved in greek life and do things with their frats or sororities at least once a week. The Greek life brings more students together and helps make us one big community. Many students either want to be part of the greeks for the connections and friends but if they don't, they are not treated any differently by their choice. Many of the Greek organizations have housing on campus that is offered to their members if they would like to be more involved.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students are very involved in campus sports, especially football. If you want to go exercise, there are two gums on campus with an abundant amount of classes to participate in and equipment to use. Our school spirit is amazing, it is shown everyday by wearing gator apparel and especially on game day when fans go all out.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Some Greeks are awesome, smart, funny, and do nice things for the community. Other Greeks are irresponsible idiots who like to spend every night partying. The houses seem small but look really nice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not a big sports fan, but athletics area big part of life here. Mostly, our teams do well, and many people here are avid sports supporters. The gyms and rec centers here are top notch.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I as a non-Greek do not like the Greek life on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There aren't a lot of multicultural Greek life options. Most of the Greek life on campus is heteronormative and White. They tend to be snobby and cliquey and they party a lot. I'm not very interested in getting involved with the Greek community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I think UF's students hold a lot of school spirit. Our facilities are awesome! There are various types of activities to choose from and plenty of open space for practices and team sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: just great to go to a home game and scream in joy
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: All of our Greek life is all about parties and night life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are great here but I am not a sports person so it doesn't effect me.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Great add to the environment of the campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics provide great teamwork exercises to use.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not around Greek life, so I do not have much to say on this topic. I have never been treated rudely by a Greek student though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our school spirit is the best, as soon as you step on campus it will be known that if you aren't a gator, then your gator bait. In a friendly way though. The performance teams are amazing as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't really care for sport watching but many others seem to enjoy it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Words can't describe what it's like to be in the Swamp on game day.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There are people from all different walks of life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am a non-Greek student and the Greek life seems okay. The housing is a bit expensive for what they are getting. They do some community service from what I've heard, but they also party very, very hard.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The athletic facilities are great and up to date. They are quite large and enjoyable to go to for a workout or any sport activity. When it comes to school spirit, my school has one of the most die-hard and loyal fans that I have seen. My school bleeds orange and blue (school colors). Participating in intramural basketball and soccer was really fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Many people around campus are Greeks. You see them walk around in their matching jackets and shirts all the time, and non-Greeks usually find the Greeks annoying and cliquey. The Greeks do a few good things around campus, but they are mostly known for partying all the time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The spirit that all the students have at sporting events puts the opposing teams to shame. Multiple teams are national champions in varsity sports. Intramural sports are very popular, a majority of the people I know are on one of the teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm too old and past this to care :-)
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Gator Athletics are some of the best supported of any school I've seen. Even "lesser" sports like gymnastics, women's lacrosse and softball draw amazing crowds.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As a non-Greek, I think Greek life is expensive.  I know good people both in and out of fraternities.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: There are a variety of opportunities to get involved in sports, both as a spectator and an athlete.  The intramural teams are both fun and competitive with a lot to choose from to meet every interest; they're also a great way to make friends.  School spirit at UF is unrivaled.  Go Gators!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics at my school are extremely fun to take part in but watching or playing. The campus's students are very interested in sports team, also including intramurals. The school spirit is defining and exciting to be a part of. UF has several practicing field for non-varsity teams, although I believe they can be a bit more updated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek life is very terrible because it does not affect the social atmosphere of the campus and all they do is throw parties involving alcohol.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Student involvement in club sports is very good accompanied with very athletic facilities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am not a Greek, nor did I rush/pledge, but I do not really mind the presence of Greek life on campus. This may be because the people that surround me in my classes are not Greeks for the most part, but I still don't have a problem with them. I do find it a bit frustrating that it's almost impossible for a non-Greek male to get into any parties, but I barely go out so it's not that big of an issue for me. With all that being said, I do believe non-Greeks for the most part have more drive and focus in academia, and I much prefer to be surrounded with like-minded individuals, and not Greeks that only care about going out.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm personally very interested in playing and watching soccer, so it's not too thrilling that almost no attention is given to the University of Florida soccer team. I'm aware the extreme gap in talent and reputation in the football and soccer teams, but it's still disappointing, considering I hope to join the team one year. That being said, I still have opportunities to play soccer, but it's not as big in the culture of the school as I wished it was.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fans at games are a mix of students and alumni, which means that they are all high spirited. The athletic facilities are well-maintained and they offer a wide variety of classes and equipment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am part of Greek Life at UF. I hold a position in my sorority and I view it as a huge part of my life on campus. I live in my sorority house, and have made the most amazing friends from joining. A lot of people view Greeks are prissy and snobby, but that is not the case. We are extremely involved on campus, and being in my sorority has truly helped me in becoming a better and more independent person.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Coming from a high school with barely any school spirit, I was so excited to become a Gator. Everyone one campus is always repping Orange and Blue and it's so easy to attend all the different games. Being number 1 in both gymnastics and softball for the past couple of years has really increased the spirit. No matter how our team does, we have the best fans.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Since I am only attending for graduate school, I don't know much about Greek life on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: This year, nearly all of the football games were sold out. Equally so, soccer games, softball and baseball games, and basketball games were packed with fans.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I joined greek life as soon as I got here because everyone told me it was the quickest way to meet people and that "everyone does it." I wish I had waited to join greek life, I wish I got to know all of my options and alternative ways of meeting people besides greek life. I came from out of state and did not know anyone, so I thought it was the right move. I love my friends in my sorority, but alot of times it seems corrupt. Not just my sorority, but the system as a whole. It seems exclusive and limiting. I feel that now its hard to make friends outside of greek life, and when people find out I am in a sorority, they have assumptions about my character before getting to know me. Those are some cons. There are pros, such as networking, community service, philanthropy, and academic support.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics is one of the university's strong points. There are a great amount of fitness classes to try and the gyms are immaculate. Theres also plenty of opportunities to play any kind of spot you want. Football is huge and bring everyone together in the fall.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Most of the campus seems to be affiliated with the Greek life on campus and they make other people on campus seem less important or not worthy of their time if they aren't a part of the Greeks social atmosphere, at least in my experience.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Information about intramural sports is hard to find because the campus is so focused on football and men's basketball because those are the most popular sports season.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The football games are great. Everyone gets so hyped up over them, so it's a great atmosphere in the stadium whenever there's a game.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not a part of Greek Life myself, so I know that members of Greek Life tend to only hang out with other members of Greek Life, which is kind of cliquey and non-inclusive. However, my sister is in a sorority, and I know that she loves her sisters there, so it is good for people who are a part of it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are a huge part of the school spirit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I love being in a sorority. It is great to have a group of girls that I can always go to. I'm also from out of state, so it really helped me assimilate to the campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: During the fall, foorball games are a huge event and are looked forward too. During the rest of the year, attendance at games aren't as large, but a good amount of students go.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I personally am not a part of the greek life here on campus, so I can't really say much about it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are such an important part of the University of Florida's student life. Whether a student is a part of the team themselves or are a spectator- everyone feels as if they are a part of the action.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is great diversity on campus, especially through student organizations. But in a way that can hurt us, because the divide is very apparent and the atmosphere can become very us versus them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Our studen rec center is one of the best in the country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Personally not into the greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are great to watch, especially as a student. Go Gators!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is a large degree of diversity on campus. Most are accepted, but there is always the one instance where someone isn't. Most of the students couldn't care less if someone is in a minority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know much about UF's Greek life and how it affects the social atmosphere of the campus. Most non-Greeks find them to be extremely annoying and snobbish.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students are very involved in athletics! Most of our school's teams are extremely good, especially basketball and gymnastics. Fans are very supportive of the players, and they love to show off their school spirit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I love Greek life here, it is extremely prevalent on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: You can not go wrong with UF gamedays, big SEC schools will always have great sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is definitely stigmas around being Greek and the "connections" that come with it. There are a lot of "prestige" organization that you can't join without these Greek connections. Student Government is known to revolve around the Greek community and it's involvement. You almost can't be involved in SG without having letters. Greeks are known to be cliquey and the secrets they have with pledging are known to get between friendship, including very close ones. It's almost like you're Greek or you're not. It's not easy to see any overlap.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I unfortunately can't give the most valid/detailed review because I didn't get into Gator sports until my senior year. I wish I had become a bigger fan sooner, because my first football game got me hooked. The crowd is incredibly loyal (no matter how bad we're beat) and the enthusiastic cheers truly show that. We organize our events around all of these games because we all know that Gator games take priority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I've just never been that into sports I guess. For people who love tailgating and dying of heat in the swamp, this is your school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I was a part of Greek life because I thought it was the thing everyone did. It didn't workout for me.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The Gator Nation has great athletics and facilities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I haven't interacted with Frats much, just members
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We're the Gators. We're obviously the best.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our Greeks have had some issues in the past (like all universities) but for the most part they are all very involved with the community and want to give everyone an opportunity to experience life as a Greek. The parties are never over the top but they are present, safe, and fun. Greek housing is typically cheaper than any on campus housing but since our srats and frats are so large, getting to live at the houses is difficult. Thankfully, there are LOTS of on campus housing options directly next to frat and srat houses.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our football team was pretty great this year, especially compared to the past few years. Everyone shows up at every sporting event that they can to support their gators and cheer them to victory. I go to the gym very often and our facilities are absolutely beautiful and up to date. The athletes are smart, hard working, and dedicated to what they do. They know that they are students just like the rest of us and treat everyone as equals.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The athletic program here is one of the best in the nation and it is known all over the country.  Our teams haven't faired well in recent years, but they have one of the best legacies in the country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Some are viewed as worse than others because of reputations and actions that individuals do. Some also are very stereotypical and not what you imagined. I a m a legacy for a sorority and when my aunt described her experience I thought it sounded fantastic but when I did research on the chapter here I was disappointed. Some people take it too far as if their life depends on it but others are 'acceptable'.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It is the only thing people seem to bond over; people do not really try to connect unless they need something for you or like sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is very prominent here at UF, but it is not reveered by a majority of the student body. It is seen very much as an extension of high school where students are segregated in cliques.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The Gators did pretty well this football season, but we have amazing sports teams such as our swim team, soccer team, gymnastics team, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: With the international program, there are a lot of diverse students on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: As a Greek student, I'm obviously going to have some biases. Greek students are extremely involved and campus and are usually not received well by non-Greek students. Greek housing is mainly located in two places, fraternity and sorority row, with a few stragglers scattered around campus. It's super cheap compared to off-campus and dorm living. I'm extremely glad I joined a sorority because it opened up so many personal and professional doors for me. The amount of people you meet and get to know in Greek life is an opportunity you would never be afforded otherwise.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Going to an SEC school means everyone loves football and basketball. It's super fun to go to the games a lot of the campus live revolves around them. It's great to be a Florida Gator!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I love the greek life
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Gator Sports are some of the best around
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Being a part of Greek life here is a big deal, practically everyone is in a sorority or fraternity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Workload is insane. Professors are always willing to help you. Registration process is very organized but they obviously give priority to juniors/seniors. Study areas are great.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: There is a very diverse range of academics.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Although many people at UF party hard, they also study hard too. On any given night, the libraries are full of people (24 hour library).
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I would say that are academics are among the best as far as what you get out of it. However, we do have some jerk professors and the work load can be pretty intense at times.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: At this school. you have to earn your A's.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Registration is overall fair, as seniors get first choice. Workload is mostly minimal and I feel that more focus is placed on studying. Definitely a great variety in personality of professors that you have to be adaptable to. I think UF also has a great variety of degrees that can act as many stepping stones for pre-professional school.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Professors are absolutely wonderful; they truly care about their students, and most will do their best to be available for their students. Curriculum is challenging, but not overwhelming. The registration process is easy as the majority of it is done online without the need for an administrator. The workload is manageable so long as you don't slack off.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There's a reason why UF is the top ranked school in FL! Most professors care about the students and want to make sure we succeed. Registration process is super easy - just learn how to read your Degree Audit and get the Holds off early. Workload is the same of any other school like UF - there's a lot. However, there's off campus resources to help study. Usually students pair up with studying at Library West or Marston.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I have never been challenged as much in my academics then I have at UF, being challenged like this is only going to help me in life after college
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The registration process seems a bit overwhelming at first, but only because there are so many interesting classes offered. Advisors are great with providing resources for offering the correct classes to take for certain majors and which classes seem interesting for each individual's interests. There are also several online resources that provide the same results that are free and available 24/7 to all students, and even parents.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Attending the University of Florida is stressful because of the high caliber of curriculum, professors and courses, but the value of the education is worth the work
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The classes are challenging and the workload is manageable as long as time is managed correctly.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Many study abroad opportunities with great professors
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: UF offers a variety of majors. A lot of people even go to farriors to change their major. The academic advisors are always there for the students. Some classes require student to put in a lot of work, while others, the does not.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The academics here are outstanding!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: best education in the state of florida by far!  a diploma from UF is a great stepping stone to finding a great job out of school
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: It's a tough school but that just means that the school gains a better name for itself.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: We have the best academics in the state and are extremely close to becoming a top 10 public school.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I love my major. I bounced around a little but my major turned out to be the perfect fit for me.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: A degree from UF is prestigious.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Majors aren't declared until the end of sophomore year.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: All of the professors I've had thus far in my two semesters of attending this school have been fantastic and care about their students.  The curriculum really isn't too terrible, especially since I'm an education major.  Registration process is so beautiful and easy... love it.  Workload also isn't bad at all, I have a lot of free time this semester.  Love studying in Marston Library and Library West, two of my favorite locations.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Finance is a relatively challenging major at my school. I think I am becoming extremely prepared for a future career in Finance because of my plight at my university. I think the college of business is extensively supportive of their students. There are comstantly career fairs and info sessions focused on furthering your career and positioning yourself in better places for opportunities. The Dean of our college often reminds us that no one wants a degree that is vanilla! You want your experiences at the university to be valuable and be more than just a piece of paper. Having those words of encouragement motivate me to push through my workload and continue to be involved on campus.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I am currently in the pre-ocupational therapy program and it is relatively hard, with a lot of required studying
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Apart from Financial accounting, the business college is perfect and every professor is the best, most knowledgable choice.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I love all of my professors and what they teach. You need to look really good on paper to get initially accepted into UF. Low GPAs and test scores will kill your chances of getting accepted.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Lots of stuff offered that relates to my major
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I always feel fortunate to be at such a great academic institution. The faculty is amazing and truly care about the well-being of their students. Courses are video-taped to accommodate different learning styles. And changes are actively made based on our feedback.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: The most important aspect of programs and majors at UF is maintaining a high GPA to be able to stay in them.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Professors are nationally recognized, study options are abundant, and good opportunities for internships and jobs are plentiful.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: University of Florida has one of the best Industrial Engineering programs in the country, therefore I get much respect and many benefits for choosing the program.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The university of Florida is a place to accomplish an endless amount of goals.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I haven't done an internship but I have shadowed a few people before.  Internships involve a time commitment outside of school that I was unable to commit to since I am a single mother. I am currently a registered nurse.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: I am a pretty good student besides the fact that being a mother takes precedence over school work at times.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: Finance in the Warrington school of Business is extremely well promoted and supported. There are so many opportunities to be involved within the school whether its being a warrington diplomat, cap mentor, or even a peer leader among multiple other leadership experiences and business organizations. The workload is manageable but can be tough to keep up the critical tracking gpa.
Academics.Author: College Freshman
