Academics.Review: There are countless internships available through the school you are in for your major. I am in the College of Journalism, and about 15 internships are posted weekly. It's very easy to apply and get involved right away.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I love my major. My adviser is very helpful but the classes are difficult.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I dislike the suggested course load one must take in order to get selected into their program of choice. Without taking summers it is really hard to get good grades.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: CLAS, or the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences offers tons of internship and volunteer opportunities and tutoring services for those in a pre-health related major. However, I have not partaken in any of them, so I can't give a true preference.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Getting into the major that I wanted was relatively easy. It didn't have any strange admission requirements.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I do not have any plan for internship since I am on pre-dental track
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The University of Florida is enormous, with thousands of students enrolled in the Warrington College of Business Administration. All of these students must take these 7 required courses before continuing on with their specific major. These classes, and most classes, are taught by a professor, not just a graduate student. In order to cater to these thousands of students, most of the classes required are going to be online lectures. Basically 50% of your education is going to be behind a computer screen. However, there are countless opportunities to get involved in the business school and to meet other business students.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: My major program is great. It is very challenging and time-consuming but will surely be worth the pain.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: My major of interest is film and there is not a very good film program at UF and there is barely any film culture in the town.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I love my major but I am afraid that i may not be able to find a job after i graduate.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: With the many majors offered, I had plenty of help from my advisor to plan out my remaining time at UF
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: All majors require a lot of hard work and commitment
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Very good professors and classes
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The liberal arts college is very large
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Must choose a major day of orientation. Be ready.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I started in engineering which had very rigorous admission criteria; now I am in the college of liberal arts and sciences, which has to be more lenient since it is a huge department.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: There is such a large variety of majors, you have to really not know what you want to do to not pick one.  Once you have your major, the courses and everything you need to take to graduate is pretty straight forward - they even give you a guide to what you should take every semester to graduate in four years.  Plus, UF has a great academic program - no matter what you choose, you know you are getting a top education.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: As a political science/history double major and minor in Spanish, all of my classes are in the college of liberal arts and sciences (CLAS). I love these programs!  The best asset for these programs is the staff.  They are all really approachable and knowledgeable of their subject.  There are also internship and job opportunities sent out by CLAS, what feels like every day, so the students always know what is available to us.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The largest majors in the school happen to be the top in the country. Also a huge variety.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Internships are stressful but they pay really well and build your resume.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Getting into the Graduate School of Accounting was simple.  Filling out an application, having my parents fill out their section, and providing proof of Florida Residency, due to the fact, that they placed me in as an out-of-state student, which I have lived in the same area of Florida, my entire life.  Small error to fix, even though somewhat inconvenient, since I just started my 4th year at UF, no big deal, except when I saw what an out-of-state student would have had to pay if in my same position.  Wow!  Due to the graduate school being separate from the bachelor's program, everything had to be done over again, and that error happened to 2 other friends of mine, so we had to do quite a bit of hustling to get it all in by September 5th, but all is fine now.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Time was demanding, responsibilities many, pay was awesome, and my position was account payable/receivable.  I work at my school occassionally going to classes, taking notes, helping out with the Study Edge Program.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I transferred into the public relations program from FIU and it was a very easy transition. I love my counselors and professors. Everyone is very helpful and well informed.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I absolutely love my program. The facilities are great and the workload is relevant. Teachers and counselors are always trying to help students get internships or jobs.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The school of engineering at UF is really strong. They have a lot of opportunities for internships and growth outside of the classroom with clubs. The curriculum is challenging but interesting and useful.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I have not had an internship but plan to have one eventually. They are relatively easy to find because of the career fair every semester but mot of the vendors are looking for older students.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Getting in to the Biomedical Engineering program is proving a little difficult for me because it is required that a certain class be taken at a certain time and I was not aware of this until that time period had passed but I am still trying anyway. However most programs do not require an admission process if the student starts in the program as a freshman
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Great classes, professors, and opportunities in all areas
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: My program had an individual admission process
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Lots of high level classes offered
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Great opportunities in the music department
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: It was extremely challenging with a very high work load, but I loved every minute of it
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Internships are a great opportunity to find out what you really want to do after school, and to line up a job immediately following graduation.  Internship opportunities are sent to my email from the school often.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The curriculum, professors, and workload at UF have all been pretty great so far. The professors are all understanding, the curriculum is strong, and the workload isn't too heavy so that students are not completely overwhelmed. There are also study abroad programs for students to get a true life and college experience.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Since I have only just finished my freshman year at the University of Florida, I do not know much about internship opportunities for my major. I do know that my major will make me look unique when I apply for the veterinary program, which is one of the best in the country.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: It's flexible with the changing times.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: A great amount of major options
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The professors are really informative and know what they are talking about
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: It was academically challenging to attain acceptace into my program. While I'm not sure what is the most important aspect to getting accepted I will say that my advice would be to get above average on all of the statistics released from the previously admitted class. Also be sure to participate in as much volunteering and shadowing as possible.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: We make about $12 an hour depending on where it is located. The staff pharmacists do a grey job of teach us by giving us the chance to do each type of responsibility we will have once we graduate. Overall it is a very valuable experience that will aid in the determination of which area we wod like to work in. We are required to do an 80 hour unpaid internship twice in two different settings by our school. Most of our responsibilities are those that will be ours once we graduate so we can learn to master them.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: There are several students all over the world applying for my program. Therefore, admission into the university is quite difficult for the Liberal arts and Sciences program. One top that was helpful for me was that if you do not get in your freshman year, go ahead and attend another college and then apply as a transfer student upon completing your AA or AS degree.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Being in the Liberal Arts and Sciences program at UF is such a rewarding experience. This program has taught me so much in such a short amount of time. What I love most about my program is that it has fully prepared me for all of my future endeavors!
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Highly rated. Heavy workloads but learn a lot. Definitely feel prepared for future classes.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: My program (Classical Studies) is small but I definitely feel that I've found my niche! So far I've only worked with graduate assistants (and not professors) but that will be changing in the fall. Still a decently heavy workload, but not too overbearing (I am learning a dead language, so it's bound to be challenging). Will be double majoring in Philosophy as well.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I love the major that i chose. I get to learn so much and at the same time the major that i chose also offers so many ways to get hands on experience.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: There are a lot of internship opportunities for everyone in my department the only downfall in my opinion is that they would require you to relocate because in order to make good money my major heals with big cities.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Teachers are mostly very aware of the actual needs of a major like advertising, and that's building a portfolio, making connections, and studying current trends and cases with such quick change. Alumni network is exactly what you need, there are more internship opportunities all the time, and several (even 24/7) computer labs with Adobe.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Never personally not been able to register. Use tutoringzone or studyedge, study in Lib West if you're facey, look up course reviews.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Intro classes are large lecture halls, so professors won't know you unless you go to office hours. Registration is a pain because it goes by credit hours and restricts you until your appointed time. The demanded and good classes always fill up quick!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Anything pre-med or prehealth major requires a lot of science and math coursework. Many of the intro classes are difficult only because they are weed out classes. One realizes you really have to practice and practice before your exams. Students should take advantage of office hours and most importantly the TAs! They are always willing to help out! Go to advising early; the wait time for advisers can take hours of your day.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: UF Engineering has a great reputation.  The Engineering classes are not easy.  Great facilities, but I am only a freshman.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: UF offers a ton of majors.  I have not met a lot of professors yet, mostly TA's.  Registration is online, like it is at almost all universities.  You can't get into higher level classes without carefully reviewing both pre-requisites and that the right course will be offered in the semester you need it, but there are a lot of sections offered for the lower level courses.  Workload is manageable, but you have to be disciplined and organized.  There is always a temptation somewhere on campus.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I feel very challenged at UF.  I love the professors and have had great classes.  The registration process is easy and the workload so far has been manageable.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The academics are challenging. The workload is large and some professors are difficult.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: UF has a great agricultural and life sciences college and a ton of options for animal science majors. The vet school is huge and offers many programs.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The Fine Arts program at the University of Florida is highly competitive. The last years have been a great experience.The professors are very knowledgeable, helpful, and understanding. I work full time during the nights at the university and go to school full time during the day as well. It has been a struggle but in the long run it has help me become a more motivated and strong individual. Finding time to work on projects and manage work has made be develop very good time management skills. The course work for the fine arts field is very dense, thus requiring me to do tremendous amounts of projects outside of class. The faculties with regards to class workspace and workshop are very clean and spacious, allowing  us students to work in a clean and friendly environment. Class lab hours are always open for student 24 hours a day, but must have key or ID access. Overall, I enjoy the school and and i am currently coming up to my final year here.

Academics.Review: Chemical Engineering is tough. The workload isn't that bad but the exams can be brutal. The facilities like the chemistry lab building for freshman is terrible in my opinion because its just disgusting. The advisors love to push internships and job opportunities on freshman and stress them out but i think they are wrong to do that. Most major companies will not give you an internship until your junior year when you have some experience in your field. Also, if you focus on research and internships and let your grades fall below a 3.0 average then you are absolutely in bad shape. HR looks at your GPA first thing before you get an interview. If it is below a 3.0 you can hardly get a job anywhere unless you work contract jobs, which do not pay as well and the work conditions will be sub par.

Academics.Review:
The challenges I encountered as a transfer student included several places in the application process that assumed I had graduated high school (like your sign-up form!). I have a GED and AA, so it was a bit stressful trying to figure out how to fill out the application. It also took a while for my permanent residency to be validated, so for a while I was accepted as an international student.

As a transfer student, the most important criteria for admission were an AA degree, a good GPA, and having all the right classes taken for biology (like Chemistry 1 and 2). The essays were short (in fact it was hard to fit all I wanted to say in them!), and probably pretty different from the freshman application process.

Tip: leave enough time to go through the application form. It wasn't nearly as straightforward or user-friendly as I expected from such a large institution.

In such courses professors will see you as a number unless you make the time and effort for them to know you, and grade policies are very strict. Campus.Review: Downtown is just east of campus; there are clubs, restaurants, pubs, and regular outdoor concerts.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Gainesville wouldn't really be on a map if it wasn't for UF.  But, there are things to do in Downtown and Midtown, so it isn't a dead city.  There are also plenty of areas to go shopping and whatnot.  All the cultural events and activities are put on by school organizations.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Gainesville is a dull city. I am only living here for UF.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Always something going on either off or on campus.  Athletics being the best and the biggest, plus cultural art shows, plenty of activities, especially on the weekends.  Even though I work, many events don't start until late afternoon, evening.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Gainesville isn't the safest city, so it is best to stay in groups when going out. A lot of activities and events around town are through the college.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The city is similar to other suburb areas like Wesley Chapel where the main activities are often related to family plans.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The college town feel really is what sold me on the school. I love seeing the orange and blue EVERYWHERE and being a part of it is amazing
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Love it. Everyone is polite and helpful unlike my hometown of Miami, Florida
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Lots of great places to hang out and study
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: UF is always updating and providing students with the best experiences
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: The locals love UF. But Gainesville is a "love it or hate it" kind of town. UF is like it's own little town with Gainesville which is really cool, but a lot of the surrounding area can be described as "hick town." But there are certain places nearby that are gorgeous.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The campus is gorgeous. There is a lot of space for students to relax and enjoy the day. The Southwest Recreation Center is an excellent athletic center that includes small classes such as Zumba and Yoga. There are several libraries and each are great.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Most students seem thoroughly happy in Gainesville while attending UF. There is enough to keep life interesting, but not enough job opportunities to continue residing in Gainesville after graduation.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: There is some stuff to do outside of campus but if you are not all about the bar scene then that really limits your options sometimes
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Besides the university, there's really nothing in Gainesville.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: Definitely a college town. Not sure why you'd want to live in the area if you weren't affiliated with the University. Definitely plenty of places to eat, and downtown/midtown has most of the nightlife.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Campus is decent. Beautiful Collegiate Gothic architecture, so not very modern, but definitely has a "college feel."
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The most unique thing about the University of Florida would have to be the excellent student life that we have. No matter where you go in the city or on campus you will see a Gator somewhere. The swamp life at my school is also something that sets it apart and makes it unique.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: I mentioned above that the student life is one of the best things in my opinion. We have a great athletic program and that is something that i absolutely love about the University of Florida.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: I like Gainesville, the city if beautiful. It has a big city feel but the small town charm. There is not much to do if you are not into the drinking scene and i would like to see more of that.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Gainesville is 99% UF. Most "cultural" things are student based or run, and the shopping isn't amazing, those are the only negatives.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Beautiful big campus, gym, athletic facilities and enthusiasm, massive alumni base filling football and baseball games and expanding the campus. Best place in the world.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: 24/7 main library with Starbucks across from the center of the bar scene (Midtown) and just a ton of tradition and things to do in general. Renovating the student center and adding some elaborate building right now, some are a little old but beautiful brick surrounded by Spanish moss. Greek life is where its at but there's clubs for everyone, and I mean everyone.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Gainesville is very much a college town and other than that a swamp. Many restaurants to choose from; a lot of fast food. Midtown and Downtown are some main attractions as well as Lake Walburg.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Many activities and opportunities to get involved in. Campus is a little unmaintained, but new developments and buildings are being constructed. Many spacious libraries on campus including Library West, which is open 24 hours. The two gyms on campus offer tons of recreational activities to work out.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Being part of the Gator Nation, a great sense of community and spirit exists and binds students and faculty together for a lifetime.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: I like it because it is a real college town.  Almost everything in Gainesville revolves around UF life.  Whether you are on campus or in town, students are treated well.  Locals recognize that students bring in a big economic boom and they are usually pretty decent toward us.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Student Union is awesome and currently under construction to be even better.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: I love the University of Florida.  The academic programs are top notch.  I am involved with campus activities such as the Student Union Board.  The university cares about their students.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: There are plenty of things to do in Gainesville. Mostly revolves around nature.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: UF has wonderful facilities. Broward dining is my only complaint.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Students have so many opportunities to become involved at UF. The student life is amazing. Definitely take advantage of gator nights, the greek life and the 1000+ student organizations.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Facilities in general are really nice for the most part. There are a lot of events and traditions students can take part in.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: There are a tons of opportunities, academic and social, for students. There are hundreds, if not thousands, of clubs students can join.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: More people are involved in extracurricular activities than other colleges I have attended. The academic level is the best in Florida.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The libraries are huge, the student hangout places are great and always full of people.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Not much to do outside of campus, but the atmosphere is great. People are friendly and the bus system is great.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The traditions are why I love being a gator. Football games, gator growl and a legacy the school has made will always be important to the students here.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: The university of Florida is one of the most prestige colleges in Florida. This university offers a plethora of opportunities, involvement and organizations.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: Its a college town, so its super fun, but mostly if you are a college student.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: There are computers everywhere. Each student is alotted 250 black and white prints a semester at one specific lab, but aside from that printing cost is fairly affordable. Having a laptop is important though if note taking is easier to type for the student. Wifi is everywhere.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: The gyms on campus are the best Ive seen in an academics setting. As a research based institution the academic programs are always pushing the worlds limits. Campus life and regular social setings are great as well both on and off campus.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: The campus is surrounded by beautiful brick architecture. Many buildings dating before the turn of the century. Gainesville is considered "the city of trees," so the green space both on and off campus is widespread. With athletics being being in the top 5 in the SEC, facilities are amazing and fun to use.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: In the summer it rains everyday between 3-7pm, and is ridiculously hot and humid. Theres very little breeze compared to the rest of the state. The winters arent too bad, but the humidity makes the cold seem to stick to your skin. That being said, walking from class to class can be interesting so to speak.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: There are a lot of different things to do.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The services offered are great.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: It is either incredibly hot or incredibly cold. Or rainy. But that's just Florida.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Save for a few rainy Florida days (which can be nice!), the weather is perfect and can't be beat.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The machine shops are awesome!
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Included in tuition are the costs for public transportation that goes from private apartment complexes to local hangout in downtown, midtown, and malls along with several important stops around dorms, libraries, and important campus stops.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The open fields have benches and campus is equipped with areas for free speech entitling the students to offer opinions on heavy subjects out of home and classroom locations. Gyms are located near bus stops for transportation around famous and fully equipped with friendly staff. Traditions might get silly, but keep the "gator lovin'" strong.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Campus is friendly with huge school spirit that is contagious. People and programs are welcoming with lots of activities to get involved with.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Way too muggy and not at all breezy                         .
Campus.Author: College Student

Campus.Review: I prefer a more affluent area with fancy shopping districts and less drunken parties. Gainesville to me feels in the middle of no-where.
Campus.Author: College Student

Campus.Review: UF has outstanding history and athletic centers. It should be, being an SEC participant! The best place to study is the Health Science Library in UF Health Hospital, and for your 24 hour study needs, library west is always open
Campus.Author: College Student

Campus.Review: Being a transfer student and only spending my last 2 years of undergrad there, I did not take much advantage of the extra opportunities UF offers. However, TRiP looked like fun, where you get to go on group outdoor trips across the country.
Campus.Author: College Student

Campus.Review: I have never felt like I was out of place at UF its always been a second home for me.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Lets just say I have never not been able to find a ride back home
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Being a computer science student at UF I can honestly say that the network that UF provides and the technology in its labs are some of the best in the country.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Gainesville weather can be a bit harsh during the summer and cold during the winter but that doesnt change how people go about their days at UF we love it even if we say we don't.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Available to do a variety of activites
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Students can find a ride anywhere.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Your never know what to expect from the weather it can be very cold in the mornings, and extremely hot in the evenings. And some seasons the rain never seems to cease.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: So many student so little parking. Parking decals are up the butt in prices.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Lots of local nature parks, recreational parks, and sports. Its easy to just join in with people playing volleyball, basketball, and making friends in the process. One this that is really great about Gainesville is that there are allot of friendly drives, not allot of people getting cut off in traffic. Its definitely a safe environment , the school and city police provides students with criminal warnings whenever something bad happens through emails and text messages.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: bus drivers are not very good
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Small, country town. The university is what makes it
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The library has computers but people will sit at the tables with computers even when they bring their own. Still, there would not be enough computers for every one. We get 200 free printing pages every semester
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: there should be more service during weekends and summer.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Overall its ok, but could improve.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: I have had little to no difficulties with the network.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Lots of stuff to do year round.
Campus.Author: College Student

Campus.Review: I live near the Hume parking garage and think that it is somewhat convenient. I think with more spots for freshman and undergraduates in general life would be easier.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The town is centered around the University. Most of the economy is as well. There are some cool on campus attractions such as shows and museums, but as for the rest of the city, you have to search for much else besides a restaurant or mall.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Printing is great on campus-- we get a certain amount of free black and white prints each semester. I have yet to run out of free prints.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: I take the bus to and from campus from my apartment every day. I wish there was a cheaper option for long distance travel, such as a train.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Any available place to park on campus with an off-campus decal is quite far from the actual hustle and bustle of campus.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The buses run about every 15 minutes, so they are a convenient source of transportation.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The weather is bipolar, always keep an umbrella because it rains a lot.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There was one computer lab in particular that I really liked going to.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Those who you surround yourself with impact this.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There is some limited printing available on campus. The WiFi on campus can be hit or miss at times and can be very difficult to deal with.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: It's the epitome of a college town as most activities in the city are centered around campus or are somehow related to the university.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The UF wifi can be a pain but the labs are really good especially since you can print up to 250 pages for free.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: You have to love Florida weather. Shorts are an almost year-round staple. Summer can get pretty brutally hot, but then again, that's the price you pay for not having to shovel snow in the winter months!
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: words of advice... Buy a scooter. You will have more parking options and can avoid using the public transportation system (which is reliable, but time consuming).
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Pretty hot all year long and rainy in the summer
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: The RTS at UF is wonderful. The buses take you almost anywhere you need to get to including the mall, classes, the dining halls, the stadium, off campus housing, shopping centers and more. They are reliable and there is even an app for tracking the buses. There is no cost because it comes with being a UF student so all you have to do is flash your ID and hop on the bus.There are many different routes and buses to take so it is fairly easy to get to where you need quickly.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I personally think there are a lot of different places to use a computer on campus. We have multiple printing labs and many computers in every library.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I am usually never left without a transportation option. From safe vans that run on campus late at night to the buses that run virtually everywhere and stop anywhere, there are good ways to get around.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The buses are nice and run fairly often. I live on campus near my classes so i don't have to take the bus hardly at all. However, the buses will take you to places off campus if you need to and they run pretty long hours.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The town is the college. Everything about the town is for the students and primarily BY the students.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: You can only get a good parking decal if you're a graduate student or live in the dorms, the parking police are pretty strict around here.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Rainy weather makes the campus feel incredibly humid and uncomfortable.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Not much to do not very developed
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: It sometimes gets really cold which I am not used to
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: parking is the biggest pain in the butt I've ever come across, and parking decals are very expensive. thankfully Gainesville has a public transportation service that is free for uf and santa fe students.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: campus is great. parts of Gainesville are great. other parts I wouldn't even drive through at 1 in the afternoon with my doors locked. you never know what youre going to get in Gainesville.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: florida is very hot in the summer and it gets very cold in the winter (for florida) it also rains pretty much every single day spring and summer.... it's raining right now.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Computer labs are great usually not full and have open computer. Free printing up to 200 pages per semester in the student union.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The weather is usually great! Although it does rain quite a bit in Gainesville
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: It's definitely a college town, but in the best way possible.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Gainesville is a fun town that you need to explore.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Any issues I have had were quickly resolved by campus tech support.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: A bike is all you need.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There are many cultural events in Gainesville! I love the Gainesville atmosphere because it is so geared towards the school. Game days are super exciting!
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Each student gets 250 free prints at the Reitz SG Printing Lab! There are also a lot of computers available for use in libraries.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: It rains a lot in Gainesville, so you should always carry an umbrella in your backpack. Rainboots are a great investment!
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Busses always run on campus
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Night life is the basis.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: It is Florida, so expect lots of rain, humidity, cold, then extremely hot weather.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: You need a computer but there are computer labs available at all points on campus.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: It is very helpful to have some form of transportation. I would recommend a scooter or a bike because it is easy to find parking in campus for those vehicles. A car in useful for groceries and maybe if you live far from campus. Most people that live off campus use the bus but it takes a while.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Being from South Florida, it's nice to attend a school that has seasons without the snow.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: There's enough technology to get the job done.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: I felt right at home after a matter of a few days!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: WiFi is offered throughout the campus which is extremely convenient! Also with a printing lab it works great for emergencies!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: It is Florida! It is mostly sunny, warm and beautiful throughout the entire state! Not just in Gainesville!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Being an in-state student from a popular area in Florida it makes it easy finding rides to make it back home by hopping in with someone else. However I know of buses that people can take to also drop them off without the need of depending on someone for ride
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I don't really get out much (that sounds so pathetic! but studying is time-consuming). But I do know that there's always something going on outside or in the campus. Butler Plaza is a good place for all your shopping/eating/movie needs.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The fall and spring are great, but in the summer the weather is brutally hot. But that's what you get in Florida!
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The bus system is free to students and you can catch a bus that will take you just about anywhere. Just be sure to learn the bus routes.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: It rains a lot and is in the cooler part of Florida but other than it's great.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: While the technology is definitely up to date the requirements for students can be pricy and the wifi can be weak at times.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Temperature fluctuations can get pretty bothersome, since leaving early for class is usually cold, but then it can warm up a lot as the day progresses. Certain times of the year (like Spring and early Fall) experience heavy rains. Some of these storms pass over quickly, yet some linger for the whole day. Winter is nice in my opinion, since the weather is often cooler and more consistent. In Fall, it is very common to work up a sweat when walking or biking to campus.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: It is Florida. It changes from one extreme to the other. Sunny in the morning and thunderstorm in the afternoon.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Lots of attractions from nightlife, bars, scenery and sports
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Free buses, and buses runs everywhere around the city
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: The local weather is always changing and most of the time unpredictable. This does not affect the campus experience too much since Gators don't stop due to a little weather foul.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Printing lab on campus is very helpful and its hours are fair. The network always works and does not give difficulties. The network speed is also very good. Only when you are in a crowded area where there are a lot of people on the network may you experience some slowness of speed. There are always computers available on campus to use. Only during exam weeks may they be more occupied than usual. For the most part, personal computers are only necessary for convenience.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The transportation options are very good. Buses run regularly and makes it easy to move from home to school. However, some buses take longer to arrive, which makes it a problem when students are late to class or a meeting and rely on the bus as their only for of transportation. Also, the buses stop running fairly early on Saturdays which poses a big problem for students, since Saturday is the designated day to run errands and accomplish tasks that are otherwise hard to do during the week. Snap, the other form of transportation, is also very good. It provides a safe form of transpiration during late nights. However, sometimes it may take almost an hour to pick up students and the drivers can decide whether you are within distance of picking up. If not they can easily cancel your ride, and you may need to resubmit another form, wasting valuable time.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Gaiensville is a small town and you can tell my the minimal shopping places and lack of higher class night light . If the University werent here the town would probably blow away.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The local weather here in Gainesville is almost always sunny and warm, like most of Florida. When the weather changes to raining or cold the university does a great job of keeping water cleaned up in buildings to avoid injury, turning the heat on to accommodate the comfort of the students and facility in the rooms and buses as well as many of the university instructors give additional time before starting class to give students a chance to get to class on days when the weather is extra nasty.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The computers across campus all run on the most updated version of windows and are uploaded with all the possible Microsoft programs any student would need. As well as being connected to a multitude of printing centers, many of which are free, they are extremely fast. The only down side is that the windows 8 is probably the most confusing and non-user friendly operating system and can make things harder to navigate as well as make some computer lag . The compatibility is an issue as well with some of the already established publisher sites and the university sites as well.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: I hate it. I hate it. I hate it. Gainesville will be 34 degrees in the morning, 78 degrees in the afternoon, then start pouring rain in the early evening. It's the PITS!
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Although a few adjustments can be made, the technology at my school is good.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: I hate the local atmosphere here, and I can't to graduate so I can leave.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Transportation is not a problem for any student living in the city of Gainesville.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Computer labs can certainly get crowded so I would only go if necessary to print large quantities of files/hw
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Very much a college town where businesses rely on student population. Not many malls or diverse nightlife but that's not what most people come to Gainesville for anyway
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Never seen a more well-planned transit system that perfectly fits the needs of students in Santa Fe and UF
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: I believe almost anywhere on campus you can receive wireless yet when it comes to using school based computers depending on the software you need you may be better off having your own as the labs due get full during midterms and finals
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: While the Florida weather may have its inconsistencies the climate tends to be comfortable with a 60 - 80 degree range.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: The city itself tends to bring about a lot a crime among the campus but the campus itself has a very comfortable atmosphere with a lot to do.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: while sometimes the buses may be full they still provide constant transportation to and from campus that is free for students
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: There are several computer labs and printing isn't terribly expensive
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Gainesvilles weather can be very cold at times for Florida
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The school and public buses are free for students, and come with a GPS system so that students can check the location of the bus through an app. Taking the bus is not necessary, but it can be nice if it is raining or if you want to go off campus.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There are a decent amount of computers available throughout campus, but there are limited places to print for free. It is helpful to have your own printer. The wireless is usually pretty reliable, but it can be spotty sometimes.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Somewhat dingy and dangerous, I live an hour away for a reason
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Always tolerably warm even during winter, rains a lot though
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Computers are easy to come by in libraries
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Typical college town. I like that everything is centralized.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The buses are shared with the surrounding community and often come every 45 mins.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I take my computer everywhere. Campus wifi is good. I've never had a problem. Getting all the right software to initially connect to the wifi is a pain though.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Weather is mostly nice but its also Florida weather: can rain out of no where it seems like.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Great college town. Everyone loves the school and has pride in it
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: I do not use public transportation a lot here. I have a scooter and that seems like it is very popular in this town.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Gainesville can get very hot and cold.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: I walk, so I'm only reporting what I've observed in campus.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: I really like the UF app system that allows you to access their apps anywhere you go. The only problem is that the system is really slow and one can get unmotivated from just waiting.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: There are a number of computer labs on campus were you can get work done. All computers have the latest software and we have PCs and Macs to fit students' needs.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: buses are always running, except on the weekends.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: I enjoy the food, parks, and the small town feel.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Sometimes it is quicker to walk because the buses are spread far apart and traffic is bad.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: I only have a problem with the wireless internet when I am doing something important like a test that is timed, then I get kicked off and lose 10 minutes of the time to take my test.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: I am not particularly crazy about towns or big cities, especially ones with traffic problems.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: It's Florida, it's bipolar. One thing for sure though, since Gainesville is landlocked it gets colder and much hotter than other places but when there are good days they are BEAUTIFUL
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: RTS is the campus and public bus system. In the heart of Gainesville, where the school is, the bus is reliable and passes frequently. Thousands of students use it daily, even I do and I have a car. Parking is very expensive on campus
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: There are computer labs but the number of students is obviously much greater than the number of students the school can provide. Some type of computer/tablet is necessary, what kind depends on your major. It is much more convenient and in the end saves you a lot of hassle. Finding a free computer is hard
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The town revolves around the school so everyone is a die hard Gator fan. There are tons of sports games to attend at low costs year around. Since college students are a diverse group the types of activities you can find in Gainesville are diverse too. Anything from poetry slams to rock concerts. restaurants are also open late and cater to different crowds. People are friendly and respect all students because UF is a distinguished school. The only thing I would say we are lacking in is shopping. Food wise we are fine, plenty of grocery stores for all tastes and wallet sizes but there is only one mall and it's relatively small. It does have all the stores you would need though. Unfortunately if you need a speciality store like Apple, you have to travel far
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Trains and buses arent too common, luckily there is an airport in Gainesvillle!
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Gainesville is a naturally a scenic area. Also, downtown is beautiful!
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: UF uses windows, my personal favorite. They're easily accessed and have bright large screens.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The weather in Gainesville, FL has been exceptionally beautiful this current spring semester!
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Gainesville is primarily a college town, but there are many medical facilities nearby. There are also plenty of outdoor activities to do with the nearby lake and campgrounds.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Most of the time, the weather is perfect. There isn't much anyone can do to change it, so there is no use complaining about it. After all, I live in Florida!
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The campus shuttle is great and has many pickups throughout the campus. The drivers are friendly and get me where I need to go.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: I've used the public transportation to get to and from my job off campus and it was extremely convenient and easy to use. The app that's available to download in order to see which routes are active and the times that buses will be coming also made using public transportation easier.
Campus.Author: College Student

Campus.Review: Most colleges require that you have access to a computer, so it is usually easier to just have your own. The printing lab offers 300 free pages per semester, so you don't need to bring a printer.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Some days are really beautiful, and then other days are deadly hot or incredibly wet. Since most people walk around outside, the weather really affects daily activities.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The bus line goes to the major areas of gville, but the farther from campus you want to go, the less likely it is to find a bus. You personally don't need a car, but it's good to find someone who does have a car.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: There's really not much to do in Gainesville.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I hate the drastic change from almost-snowing to beach weather.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The problem is that the majority of parties at UF, are in fraternities so if you don't participate in the Greek life then your nightlife is lacking.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Rain doesn't bother or hinder me.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Computers are provided with plenty of software. For example, I did not buy Matlab for class since the computer lab provides it.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Attractions die off quickly when you move away from campus
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Free city bus fare by showing student ID and free shuttle for drunk college students at night.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: It is a definite college town!
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: There are lots of options, I just don't use that many of them since I live on campus.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: I had problems with my virus software and the university wireless, I had to download their free software. Sometimes the wireless in unreliable.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: UF is great for college students and them only. Theres tons to do if you are in your late teens, early twenties and not mush room for anything or anyone else. Gainesville itself is a pretty crappy city, and I cant wait to get the hell out the second I graduate.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Cars are nice to go home and to go shopping off campus. I usually park in a commuter lot far away. Motor scooters are a fast-growing method of transportation. Parking for them is much more convenient and they eliminate walking far distances.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: For the most part UF is great. A little boring on the weekends if you don't plan to party. There is usually plenty to do during the week. Everyone wants to be a part of the Gator Nation. Sporting events are fun and very spirited. Most of the city is centered around UF so many of the locals have no choice but to be friendly toward them.
Campus.Author: College Student

Campus.Review: Typical Florida weather. Beautiful one day and dreadful the next. Often rainy. Surprisingly cold in the winter.
Campus.Author: College Student

Value.Review: There are a multitude of ways that a person can find an intership or a job through the school. There are many professional organizations and clubs that introduce their members to companies in a much smaller setting than Career Showcase. Career Showcase is a very good event run by the CRC, but it is very crowded and intimidating. I went and talked to one of the CRC advisers and she as very helpful with my concerns and helped me figure out what I needed to do.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: There's a career resource center on campus that will help. A degree from this school will definitely get you somewhere as long as you have other experiences to help build your resume as well.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The value of a degree at the University of Florida is taken seriously.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I feel like students who are involved on campus and do well in class have very good job prospects.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: The academic advisor sends us emails with job opportunities because she knows how competitive this degree is.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: The Business program truly cares about what job you will receive once you get your degree.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I feel very confidant about my ability to get a job after graduation.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: With D1 Athlete on my resume along with my Construction Engineering degree (haven't declared yet), I feel set to be extremely successful in life.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: A degree from UF is going to be very valuable for most students, but it does not have the prestige of a degree from a top private university. I have not seen much recruiting from employers but the Career Fair is a great opportunity to put yourself out there.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: There are various opportunities for internships. The school itself is constantly recruiting students for employment. Emails are constantly sent for both.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: I know that once I graduate, I will have great opportunities available to me.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I feel confident that I will be able to find a job after school. UF offers internships and other opportunities to make us stand out against other prospects.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I have learned that a degree from the University of FLorida is one of the most valuable degrees in the country. Students with a degree from UF are looked at as highly qualified candidates with real world application.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The career center offers many opportunities and advice for students
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: A degree from the University of Florida holds great value. As a student here, I believe we are provided with countless opportunities to further our education and prepare for our careers, no matter what our field of study is.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: The quality of my degrees will be recognizable in the career world.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Students can gain life-long experiences at UF. Internships and job positions are sometimes held in the O'Connell center.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Anyone who comes from UF has an upperhand in their career. The best kids come for Uf.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Lots of help on campus from faculty and other students to find career options
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: In engineering circles, less than 20 schools are better.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Gator Nation is truly across the globe and graduating from this prestigious institution will provide a plethora of opportunities from alumni to excel within your field.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: The student career prospects are great.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I think there is a great alumni network, and I haven't used the career resource center.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: There are a lot of opportunities for internships at the career fair, and volunteering opportunities are abound.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I have a good feeling about the future and getting a job. The career resource center is a very helpful spot to go to.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I think that UF has a strong alumni base and the value of a degree from UF is widely recognized among prospective employers.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: The gator nation has a huge network you just have to get yourself out there and talk to people.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Whenever I tell someone that I go to the University of Florida, it's always a word of congratulations. People definitely look up to my school and there is a certain level of prestige attached to earning a degree from UF.  Both professionals and non-professionals would agree to that.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I found my current summer internship as a recommendation from a critique on my mid-term review for my design class. I love my current job and work along side other University of Florida graduates. The Gator Nation is everywhere.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: A degree from UF is pretty valuable. Most graduates find employment.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: A degree from the University of Florida is worth a lot, especially health professions or business. Most of the people who graduate from UF find employment.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The University of Florida is ranked the number 1 public university in the state of Florida and number 14 in the nation. So if a student applies for a job with a degree from this school, it is definitely appreciated by any employers. The school itself also offers many opportunities to get an internship or a job at any time of the students time at the school or even after they graduate. UF holds one or two career fairs a year and this a place where students can go and talk face to face with employers and get their name out and maybe land an internship or job on the spot. This is how many of my friends or family got their jobs.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I'm still navigating my career path, but I know that whatever I choose, the university is going to be more than helpful in supporting me in order to reach my goals.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Alumni network is top notch for my program, but also seems quite strong for the school as a whole. My final ceramics class included largely a professional practice portion that was very very helpful.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: I feel that earning a degree here will definitely give you an advantage over other simply because of the name.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Being in the sociology degree programs I know there are many opportunities internship opportunities, jobs and work study programs.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: The Gator Nation is strong. People who attended this institution and even those who didn't all admire and respect an earned degree from this university. the value of this degree will take you further than you realize!
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I think UF degrees are highly valued and there are plenty of opportunities around Gainesville for UF grads.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: UF degrees are recognized all across the country!
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Through the Career Resource Center, there are numerous companies looking specifically for University of Florida students.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: My degree is extremely valuable and I believe I will have a great job after I graduate. I have not had an internship yet though, however, but I will get one for sure.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: The center has all the recourses one needs, but you must have enough determination to use it yourself.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: UF carries clout with it.  Our students are humble and hard-working, to back up their intelligence.  We have an amazing career resource center and job fair.  All students are exposed to opportunities for internship prospects.  Alumni are loyal.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There are so many connections at UF with jobs and internships. Even just speaking with a professor can give you opportunities for research!! Taking advantage of everything this school has to offer is extremely beneficial to its students.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I know with my specific college they really push for experience, pushing your limits, and developing a career. I truly appreciate that and believe I am on the right path. That is why I am scared to leave due to my financial struggles. Unfortunately, if I can no longer afford it then I have to immediately leave.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The value of a degree from UF has increased and I feel like my job prospects are good for the future.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The sciences are competitive and churn out very qualified individuals, as do many other areas of the school, particularly in medicine. As I'm an English major though, its hard to gauge it personally.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: The University of Florida has one of the greatest advertising and engineering programs in the country.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Every student is motivated and has access to internships and jobs to help with their future.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: In terms of a degree from a college in Florida, your degree means more at this school than any other school. If you're going into a competitive work field, your degree from this school proves that you are a hard-worker. I promise it will help.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The level of effort put in towards student careers is absolutely amazing. There are so many opportunities and events for students to reach out and attend. If you graduate from UF without ever having a job, internship, or career established, it's your own fault.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: There are 100 ways to get involved every day
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Things are constantly changing and many times it is a matter of opinion whether or not someone may get a job. But the extensive alumni network is huge and I find Gators everywhere!
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The Career Resource Center is rated #1 in the country; you could get many opportunities right in your fingertips.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I've heard that there's lots of career options for graduates
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Many students get help with internships and job opportunities from the school. The career center is very helpful and so are the career fairs on campus.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: If you are a Gator, people love you, unless those people are from FSU, in which case they will avoid you like the plague.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I feel like after getting a degree form here I can get any job I want.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: UF is the best public university in Florida. It's also a huge research school. I've had friends that have gone to additional schooling after UF and UF is looked at highly.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: i am doing the best i could do with my mind
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: We have a career center but many people don't go. A degree from here is very valuable.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: An education from UF will help to get a job.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Certain programs are more 'job secure' (like the business school) than others (like visual/ performance arts).
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Everyone that I know that has graduated from UF got a job upon graduation.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: I have heard from both professors and alumni that people from University of Florida get first pick in graduate and job prospects. I am confident that I would be able to get a job after graduation.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: UF is a very renowned school and a degree from here is a great accomplishment. Shand's hospital offers volunteering opportunities for anyone in the medical field, so it is easy to get an early start to an internship. Florida alumni are found just about everywhere and remain their school pride throughout all walks of life. Campus services can be very helpful if you find the right person to help you with what you're looking for.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Value of a degree from UF is very high.  I've encountered many working professionals who automatically view me as reputable and bright, based on the sole fact that I graduated from UF.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: There is an easily accessible career resource center in order to review resumes and cover letter. They also give mock interviews. The school have great career resources.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: There are several job/internship fairs every semester and there are tons of alums.  I've spend a lot of time working with the career resource center and that's really helpful and cool.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There are plenty of opportunities for an individual to get at least a connection to employers. A great example of this is the Career Showcase, where plenty of employers come looking for both technical and non-technical students to join them whether it be as a job or an internship. I'd wish there were more opportunities for internships though, as they are extremely hard to get.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I feel that people that graduate from UF are expected to be at a higher level than other graduates. There are career days multiple times a month for a variety of colleges. My DPT program in particular is known to have a 98% passing rate the first time on the boards exam and we are put at high quality internship sites in our last year of school.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: There is an extremely high value on a degree from the University of Florida. This is identifiable just from telling people that I go here. Also, when I meet an alumni anywhere, there seems to be an understood connection. The career resource center is one of the best in the nation. There are so many resources and way to network here. This is considered the "Gator Nation" and it is really true that beyond the years in Gainesville, gators continue to have each others backs and aid each other in career prospects. I feel that it is an honor to get a degree from this school.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Having a large Career Showcase with many different companies involved definitely helps students get their name out there in their career field, even if they don't get a job at that moment, which can help them advance their careers after graduation from UF.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Every fall and spring semester is the career showcase, a great way to meet future employers.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Students from UF have career opportunities all across the state of Florida and everyone is looking to hire recent Gator grads.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I think UF creates an excellent environment for students to pursue opportunities to learn about what they want to do as a career. The career resource center has great services, including resume reviews, and holds events each semester like open houses and Career Fair (which is VERY popular at my school. I think that the staff is well trained and UF advertises it well.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: The alumni network is legendary at UF. Gators hire gators.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Everyone at UF is very driven. There are plenty of resources to help us land our dream jobs.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Based off what I have heard, a degree from the university carries a great deal of weight in the career world and is a valuable asset when trying to find a job.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Most times it seems people are doing well and graduate happy, but the majority of it feels like something you have to be ready to face on your own; there is not much guidance it is something you have to prepare for yourself. The quality of things are good as long as you make (sometimes demand) the effort.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There's so many opportunities to get a job or an internship as an UF student. The biggest event on campus, Career Showcase, puts all of these employers in one place so UF students can get out there and score that dream job or internship. It's great!
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: gator nation is widely known
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: A degree from UF is one of the most well respected degrees you could get, outside of Ivy League schools. A degree from this school is known to make you prepared and knowledgeable far beyond any other students.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Getting my degree from a school like UF would show my future employer that I am a hard worker and that I always give my very best every single day
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: At every corner, and with every day's emails, there are new opportunities for research, jobs, and internships. Because the University of Florida is notorious for its excellence in numerous fields, there are innumerable opportunities on and around campus, and even with partners of the school or contacts of those who work at the university.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Im not too sure about this.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The alumni network at UF is amazing. While at school they provide many resources such as career fairs and job search materials.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Many kids are pre med so be prepared
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: A degree from the University of Florida means something in the career field nationally and it is well known that if you can succeed here, you will be set up for success in the real world
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: UF is known for its job opportunities after graduation. As an undergrad student, the school provides countless resources to help build your future career.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: In Florida and around the country, UF is highly regarded and has a very large alumni based. Gator Nation is strong!
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There are a alot of different resources to use to find a job. There are a alot of on campus jobs for students that are easy hours. There is also a career fair where students can go to get familiar with the interview process.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The value of a UF is high and makes alumni highly considered prospects
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: There are a lot of majors that one can choose from. There is something called career day where people are allowed to get interviews and could get an internship.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: This is a top University in the state of Florida.  I am in a top program and it has a 100% hire rate upon program completion.  I have an internship lined up through my program for the spring and have high expectations for next semester.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Overall the opportunities here at UF are endless and you must venture out to get involved and utilize the resources that this campus has to offer. The more that your are involved, the more people you will meet and therefore you will have more connections and discover even more opportunities! Academic advisors can help you choose your classes for your major and they can also give you information to help you get involved if you do not know where to start. There are numerous clubs and organizations that tailor to your interests and different types of organization fairs that range from helping you find part-time work, volunteer opportunities and even internships. Personally being a minority at this school could make you feel like you will not fit in however, there are many different cultural groups that you can join as well whether if it's related to your major or simply something that you enjoy doing! When I first started I struggled with my confidence and kept to myself. However, I soon learned how to get out of my comfort zone and become open mined to tremendous experiences. The opportunities here will help you learn that college is more then just studying and parties but it is a growing experience that you can take with you even after graduation.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I am a freshman so I have not used the career center yet, but I know a degree from the University of Florida will greatly assist me in finding a career I enjoy.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: i have received my internships on my own but am just getting to the stage that i will need to utilize the student resources more as i get closer to graduation
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Almost everyone you find/meet is willing to help you find the right career for you. I was in awe when I experienced this
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Theres many different recruiting events throughout each semester and I get emails from the business school regarding internship opportunities.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: The Student Career Center knows what it's doing.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: We have a career showcase that will blow your mind. Everyone here is extremely competitive so big names frequent our school looking for employees.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Everybody is super happy with the education at UF and they know that when they graduate they are going to have an impressive degree.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I don't know much about it yet, but it seems great.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: We're a huge school, and thus we have a massive alumni network. There are career fairs all the time where you can meet with recruiters and sometimes get hired right on the spot (happened to a friend). All of my friends who graduated were able to find jobs (yes even a geology major and a drama major).
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I have heard of many people that have gotten an engineering job right of Florida. I am fairly confident I can do the same.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I have bright futures and the process was great. It shows up directly in my university account and someone is always available when I call the office with questions.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: They gave me money, so I was happy. Other people I know did not get anything
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Very helpful when you ask questions
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: UF does not give as much financial aid as I expected and it has resulted difficult when paying expenses.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: I wish the school had a better way of giving information to students because it was very hard to determine your finanicial aid status.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Financial aid is usually automatically updated and disbursed on time for me. However, it can be a hassle if you can't figure out where some money went directly to.
